#; Tag#: 05.04.33
#; Issue#: IB02040430
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom: Long stall when booting into DOS by USB storage on Intel SkyLake platform
#; RootCause: The stall malfunction due to Intel SkyLake no longer support I/O port 0x61 bit 4 refresh cycle toggle
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.02.33.0820
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.02.32.0811
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.02.05.0127
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.02.05.0127
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.02.29.0718
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.02.29.0716
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.02.21.0522
#; Solution: Added ACPI timer stall to optionally replace the refresh cycle toggle stall procedure in SMM instance
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02040000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbCoreDxe\UsbCoreDxe.c

#; Tag#: 05.04.33
#; Issue#: IB02960664
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: Variable
#; Symptom: In some OEM platforms, if power off system while doing reclaim, it will cause system crash permanently.
#; RootCause: System may have multiple firmware volume block services protocol instances which contain the reclaim region, so GetFvbByAddress function may get incorrect firmware volume block services protocol instance and then it will write data to incorrect region.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Check the firmware volume block services protocol instance is whether NV variable firmware volume protocol instance in GetFvbByAddress function.
#; SolutionDependency: None

#; Issue#: IB12740066
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Build
#; Symptom: DDT build failed with EmeraldLake2BoardPkg.
#; RootCause: When code optimization is disabled("/Od"), there will be two external symbols "__allshl" and "__aullshr" used in PlatformSecLib.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Replaces "__allshl" and "__aullshr" to "LShiftU64" and "RShiftU64".
#; SolutionDependency: IB12740066 fixed the side effect by IB12740064 (Adopted in 05.04.31)
#; Reviewer: IB02960000

#; Issue#: IB12740065
#; Severity: Feature
#; Category: UFS
#; Symptom: (New Feature)
#; RootCause: (New Feature)
#; Description: The feature for Universal Flash Storage 2.0 support, please find the documents in "P:\Engineering\Kernel\Spec\Disk\UFS". Add PcdH2OUfsSupported(default FALSE) to enable/disable the feature.
#;              Since UFS standard adopts the well-known SCSI Architecture Model and command protocols, UFSHCD distributes EFI Extended SCSI Pass Thru Protocol for UFS communication.
#;              Please refer to "UEFI Specification Version 2.4, section 14.7" for the detail of Extended SCSI Pass Thru Protocol.
#;

#; Issue#: IB07300231
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Security
#; Symptom: Crisis recovery fails if PeiFirmwareAuthenticationLib is not been compressed.
#; RootCause:  Doing CompMem with signatrue string in PeiFirmwareAuthenticationLib casue maching code of PeiFirmwareAuthenticationLib contain

#;             might find the wrong one

#; Issue#: IB02040425
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: LegacyBios
#; Symptom: System hang when legacy OPROM consume too large memory space in legacy memory region
#; RootCause: The OPROM overrides the data memory which allocated by CSM16 GetTableAddress function and caused memory corruption
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Update internal BiosStart and LegacyBiosImageSize records upon CSM16 GetTableAddress get called to maintain the actual used memory space boundary for preventing data memory space from override by legacy OPROM
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB04980000

#; Tag#: 05.04.31
#; Issue#: IB02960662
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Mouse
#; Symptom: Ps2 mouse doesn't work on Carrizo CRB.
#; RootCause: Send disable mouse port command (0xA7) to disable mouse before sending mouse enable (0xF4) command. This may cause enable mouse failed (some KBC fix this issue by firmware).
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Send enable mouse port command (0xA8) to enable mouse before sending mouse enable (0xF4) command.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07240000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Isa\Ps2MouseDxe\Ps2Mouse.c
#;
#; Tag#: 05.04.31
#; Issue#: IB12740062
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: SDHC
#; Symptom: Can't load the boot codes from boot partitions on an eMMC.
#; RootCause: When issuing partition switching function, boot partition configuration will be cleared.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Adjusts partition switching function to keep the boot partition configuration when switching partitions.
#;
#; (This version of Seamless SDHC is labeled as 02.12.31.0731)

#; Tag#: 05.04.31
#; Issue#: IB02960658
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: Keyboard
#; Symptom: In some platforms, if pressing any key very quickly, the Caps Lock led will flash once before entering Win8 OS.
#; RootCause: In some EC, after sending LED write command (0xED) and try to read status from status port, the receive data may be garbage not ACK (0xFA) or failed ACK (0xFE).
#;            KeyboardWaitForValues function will return failure if read incorrect data. this will cause update Caps Lock led operation work improperly.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Enhance KeyboardWaitForValues function to only exit function if timeout or read corresponding value. it will not exit function if read incorrect data.
#; SolutionDependency: IB02960658 fixes side effect of IB02960573 (Adopted in 05.03.45)
#; Reviewer: IB07240000

#; Issue#: IB07880112
#; Severity: Fatal
#; Category: SATA
#; Symptom: (ITS:0032370) System hangs during POST time on BayTrail M platform.
#; RootCause: 1. For X64 BIOS, constructor of KernelConfigLib registers gEfiSetupUtilityProtocolGuid callback function for SMM instance.
#;               System hangs when callback function in SMM is notified.
#;            2. For IA32 BIOS, pointer type is wrongly converted from UINT8 into UINTN, and thus adjacent memory is overwritten.
#; Description: 1.(Bug Fix).
#;              2.(This version of Seamless SATA will be labeled as 02.02.30.0728.00)
#;                 AhciBusDxe: 02.02.30.0728.00
#;                 IdeBusDxe: 02.02.30.0728.00
#;                 AhciBusPei: 02.02.23.0610.00
#;                 IdeBusPei: 02.02.17.0429.00
#;                 AtaLegacySmm: 02.02.30.0725.00
#;                 StorageSecurityCommandDxe: 02.01.03.0122
#; Solution: 1. Retrieve setup data from variable instead of KernelConfigLib.
#;           2. Replace UINT8 type by UINTN to avoid type conversion.
#; SolutionDependency: IB07880112 fixes the side effect of IB07880108 (Adopted in 05.04.22)

#; Issue#: IB02040416
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: LegacyBios
#; Symptom: Legacy Oprom operation become faster and hard to access to proper options
#; RootCause: The 8254 timer duration being set to 100hz on BdsEntry, however the legacy Oprom still treat the timer frequency in 18.2hz and caused the Oprom operation become faster

#; Issue#: IB02960656
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Setup
#; Symptom: (ITS:0032463)[Source override] Using KernelConfigLib in DXE_SMM_DRIVER or COMBINED_SMM_DXE driver in some platforms, system will hang during post time.
#; RootCause: The KernelConfigLib registers callback function for gEfiSetupUtilityProtocolGuid in SMM mode if library constructor is invoked before gEfiSetupUtilityProtocolGuid installed. Once gEfiSetupUtilityProtocolGuid is installed in protected mode,

#; Issue#: IB08520097
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Disk
#; Symptom: No bootable device when only PCIe SSD is plugged, PCIe NAND remapping is enabled, and HDD password is supported.
#; RootCause: When no SATA HDD is connected to SATA port, UEFI RAID OpROM is not dispatched because EFI_ATA_PASS_THRU_PROTOCOL
#;            dependency rule is not satisfied.
#; Description: 1.(Bug Fix).
#;              2.(This version of Seamless SATA will be labeled as 02.02.29.0722.00)
#;                 AhciBusDxe: 02.02.29.0722.00
#;                 IdeBusDxe: 02.02.25.0624.00
#;                 AhciBusPei: 02.02.23.0610.00
#;                 IdeBusPei: 02.02.17.0429.00
#;                 AtaLegacySmm: 02.02.22.0603.00
#;                 StorageSecurityCommandDxe: 02.01.03.0122
#; Solution: Let AhciBus install AtaPassThru protocol even though there is no HDD plugged to physical SATA port.
#;           After the last AtaPassThru protocol is notified, DelayUefiRaidOprom installs gUefiRaidOpromReadyGuid to satisfy
#;           the dependency rule of UEFI RAID OpROM.
#; SolutionDependency: IB08520097 fixes the side effect of IB08520070 (Adopted in 05.03.08)
#; Reviewer: IB07880000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\AhciBusDxe\AhciBusDxe.inf
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\AhciBusDxe\Ia32\AhciBusDxe.efi

#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208

#; Tag#: 05.04.29
#; Issue#: IB02040419
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom: POST time increased ~100ms after adopt IB02040381 pre-port-reset mechanism if system has on-board USB devices
#; RootCause: The pre-port-reset need to spend time on waiting for port reset ready
#; Description:  This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.02.29.0717
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.02.21.0523
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.02.05.0127
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.02.05.0127
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.02.29.0717
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.02.29.0716
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.02.21.0522
#; Solution: Implement USB device ignored mechanism according to USB policy to bypass the pre-port-reset if specific port has declare as ignored
#; SolutionDependency: IB02040419 fixed the side effect by IB02040381 (Adopted in 05.03.13)
#; Reviewer: IB02040000
#; RelatedFiles:

#; Issue#: IB02040418
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom: The PEI recovery malfunction when USB device plug in USB3 ports on Intel Braswell/CherryTrail platform
#; RootCause: The memory allocation for event ring segment doesn't align on 64 byte and causing transmission error
#; Description:  This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.02.29.0716
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.02.21.0523
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208

#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208

#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.02.21.0523
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.02.29.0716
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.02.21.0522

#; Tag#: 05.04.29
#; Issue#: IB12740060
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: TPM
#; Symptom: TPM 1.2 / 2.0 module cannot be detected with Intel Boot Guard BIOS
#; RootCause: Intel ME initializes the TPM in early stage when Boot Guard is enabled, which causes
#;            TPM Auto Detection feature failed to issue TPM_Startup command to discern the TPM.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Tries TPM_SelfTest command instead of TPM_Startup command to discern TPM if TPM has been initialized.
#; SolutionDependency:  IB12740060 fixed the side effect by IB12740048 (Adopted in 05.04.20)
#; Reviewer: IB02960000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Include\TpmPolicy.h
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\InsydeModulePkg.dec

#;   5. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Security\Tcg\TrEEPei\TrEEPei.c

#; Tag#: 05.04.29
#; Issue#: IB11420058
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: SCU
#; Symptom: (ITS:0031997) [Source override] System cannot boot to SCU by PS/2 keyboard when end-user press hot-key
#; RootCause: The POST is too fast, there is only 20~30ms time from PlatformBdsConnectConsole() to
#;            BdsLibStopHotKeyEvent() to get hot key. This causes Hot-Key Timer callback function not
#;            having a chance to be invoked.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Before hot-key event is closed, signal hot-key event and see if any
#;           hot-key is pressed. It also guarantees mGetHotKeyEvent's callback function can be invoked at least once.
#;           Please note that if press hot-hey right after screen back-light turning
#;           on, the timing of pressing hot-key may be missed. So, To avoid this
#;           case, it is better to keep pressing hot-key right after power-on.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02040000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Library\GenericBdsLib\HotKey.c
#;

#; Tag#: 05.04.29
#; Issue#: IB02960655
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Secure Boot
#; Symptom: (ITS:0032308) Command "msinfo32" can't show correct status of Secure Boot setting. Following are details duplicate processes:
#;          (1) Run msinfo32.exe in Windows 8 CMD prompt to confirm secure boot status is off.
#;          (2) Shutdown OS and then power on system to enable secure boot in SCU and then reset system.
#;          (3) Enter Windows 8 again to run msinfo32.exe to confirm secure boot status. It should be on but it is off.
#; RootCause: In windows 8, user presses shutdown button to shutdown system will do hybrid boot so it will restore previous setting and cause the secure boot setting isn't changed.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Add the value of SecureBoot variable to calculate ACPI hardware signature value to make sure OS will do full initialization if secure boot setting is changed.
#; SolutionDependency: None

#; Severity: Feature
#; Category: I2C
#; Symptom: (New Feature)
#; RootCause: (New Feature)
#; Description: 1. The feature of UEFI PI 1.3 I2C protocol stack. Use of PcdH2OI2cSupported(default FALSE) to enable/disable the feature
#;              2. Move the old version of I2C HID drivers to chipset packages which embedded I2C controller for backward compatible
#;              Please refer to the document under "P:\Engineering\Kernel\Core\I2C\I2C Protocol Stack Feature Guide.pdf" for detail
#; Solution: (New Feature)
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB04280000

#; Tag#: 05.04.28
#; Issue#: IB06720257
#; Severity: Tweak
#; Category: PCI
#; Symptom: (Code Adjustment)
#; RootCause: (Code Adjustment)
#; Description: 1. PCD (PcdControllerDeviceIrqRoutingEntry) restructure. Add two fields (DevIpRegValue and ProgrammableIrq) in it.
#;              2. Migrate chipset specific interrupt pin register value from PcdDeviceXXInterruptPinRegisterValue into PcdControllerDeviceIrqRoutingEntry.
#;              3. ChipsetSvc (IrqRoutingInformation) should collect IRQ routing information excluding DevIpRegValue and ProgrammableIrq for Kernel driver.
#;              Refer to X:\PCG\AP-Driver\H2OIDE_PUBLIC\Specs\H2OIDE IRQ ROUTING CHIPSET PORTING GUIDE v1.0.docx
#; Solution: (Code Adjustment)
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB11270000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Added:
#;   1. MahoBayChipsetPkg\Include\ChipsetIrqRoutingEntry.h
#;   2. SharkBayChipsetPkg\Include\ChipsetIrqRoutingEntry.h

#; Tag#: 05.04.28
#; Issue#: IB12740058
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: TPM
#; Symptom: (ITS0031761) It need press hotkeys twice to enter SCU after changed TPM 1.2 status in Dual Boot Type.
#; RootCause: Changing TPM state will make a continuing POST that reboots the system. While the continuing POST, pressing hotkey will be ignored.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Makes TPM driver to issue TPM Clear/Enable/Disable operations in DXE phase in order not to show the press hotkey information while the continuing POST.
#;           2. Refines TpmDriver.c. Moves the driver to kernel level and rename to TrEEConfigDxe.
#;           3. Renames TrEEConfig to TrEEConfigPei.
#; SolutionDependency:  (None)
#; Reviewer: IB02960000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Added:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Security\Tcg\TrEEConfigDxe\
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Security\Tcg\TrEEConfigDxe\TrEEConfigDriver.c
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Security\Tcg\TrEEConfigDxe\TrEEConfigDxe.inf
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Security\Tcg\TrEEConfigPei\
#;   5. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Security\Tcg\TrEEConfigPei\TrEEConfigPei.inf
#;   6. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Security\Tcg\TrEEConfigPei\TrEEConfigPeim.c
#; Deleted:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Security\Tcg\TrEEConfig\
#;   2. MahoBayChipsetPkg\Tpm\
#;   3. SharkBayChipsetPkg\Tpm\
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\InsydeModulePkg.dsc
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Package.dsc
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Package.fdf
#;   4. MahoBayChipsetPkg\Package.dsc
#;   5. MahoBayChipsetPkg\Package.fdf
#;   6. SharkBayChipsetPkg\Package.dsc
#;   7. SharkBayChipsetPkg\Package.fdf

#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: RTC
#; Symptom: The system will wake up immediately after shutdown when RTC wake up be triggered before. Following is the duplicate steps:
#;          (1) In SCU, set "Auto Wake on S5" to "Enabled" and "Wake on S5 Time" to "12:00:00", then press F10 to save and exit.
#;          (2) Boot to EFI shell and run command "reset -s" to perform shutdown.
#;          (3) When system auto wake up at 12:00:00 and boot to EFI shell, run command "reset -s" to perform shutdown and system will wake up immediately.

#; Tag#: 05.04.27
#; Issue#: IB02960651
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: Performance
#; Symptom: (Code Enhancement)
#; RootCause: (Code Enhancement)
#; Description: Don't cache firmware volume data to memory if FVB attributes is EFI_FVB2_MEMORY_MAPPED. This change can prevent from reading compressed data in FV twice and can improve performance if BIOS image is in SPI (Note: This change doesn't have any performance improvement if BIOS image is in eMMC).
#;              Test on ChiefRiver CRB on Windows 8.1 OS environment with Windows 8 fast enabled can reduce POST time about 220ms.
#; Solution: (Code Enhancement)
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07240000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Added:
#;   1. MdeModulePkg\Override\Core\Dxe\FwVol\
#;   2. MdeModulePkg\Override\Core\Dxe\FwVol\FwVol.c
#;
#;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#; Label#: 05.04.26

#; Tag#: 05.04.26
#; Issue#: IB12740056
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: SDHC
#; Symptom: Can't support eMMC and SD card at the same time on SimNOW.
#; RootCause: SDHC driver was failed to discern eMMC and SD card by CMD55(APP_CMD) because SimNOW eMMC supports CMD55 in idle state
#;           (assumed eMMC would fail on this).
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; (This version of Seamless SDHC will be labeled as 02.12.26.0701)
#;      SDHC  DXE  : 02.12.24.0616
#;      SDHC  PEI  : 02.12.24.0616
#;      SDMMC DXE  : 02.12.26.0701
#;      SDMMC PEI  : 02.12.26.0701
#;      SdLegacy   : 02.12.14.0402
#; Solution: According to SD card Physical Layer Simplified Specification Version 3.00, CMD55 is a prefix to ACMDs.
#;           So enhance the driver to make the judgment after ACMD41, not CMD55.
#; SolutionDependency: (None)
#; Reviewer: IB02960000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Sdhc\SdMmcDxe\Ia32\SdMmcDevice.efi
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Sdhc\SdMmcDxe\SdMmcDeviceDxe.inf
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Sdhc\SdMmcDxe\X64\SdMmcDevice.efi
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Sdhc\SdMmcPei\Ia32\SdMmcDevice.efi
#;   5. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Sdhc\SdMmcPei\SdMmcDevicePei.inf
#;

#; Issue#: IB02960648
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: IHISI
#; Symptom: (Code Enhancement)
#; RootCause: (Code Enhancement)
#; Description: Add the following two checking rules for input address before using it in IHISI library:
#;              (1) The address is not in the SMRAM.
#;              (2) If the pointer is to a structure or a buffer, then that the entire structure or the buffer does not overlap with SMRAM.
#; Solution: (Code Enhancement)
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07240000

#; Issue#: IB07240286
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: BDS
#; Symptom: (Code Enhancement)
#; RootCause: (Code Enhancement)
#; Description: Add PCD PcdWin8FastBootErrorMessageSupported to control if display boot fail message of Win 8 OS HDD when Win 8 fast boot is active.
#;              (1) The default value of this PCD is TRUE (same with original behavior).
#;              (2) If the value of PCD is TRUE, system will pop up error message when Win 8 fast boot is active and system boot fail on Win 8 OS HDD.
#;              (3) If the value of PCD is FALSE, system will not pop up error message and try next boot option when Win 8 fast boot is active and system boot fail on Win 8 OS HDD.
#; Solution: (Code Enhancement)
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02960000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:

#; Issue#: IB12740055
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: PCD
#; Symptom: (Code Enhancement)
#; RootCause: (Code Enhancement)
#; Description:
#; Standardize PCDs to control industry standard support. Following PCDs are renamed to PcdH2OxxxxSupported,
#; and related definitions of these PCDs in .env are removed if there are not used by ECP.
#;
#;           Original                                      Modified                              Variable in .env
#; PcdUefiNetworkSupported                 ->  PcdH2ONetworkSupported                     UEFI_NETWORK_SUPPORT(Removed)
#; PcdDualNetworkEnable                    ->  PcdH2ONetworkIpv6Supported                 DUAL_NETWORK_ENABLE(Removed)
#; PcdIscsiBootSupported                   ->  PcdH2ONetworkIscsiSupported                ISCSI_BOOT_SUPPORT(Removed)
#; PcdTpmSupported                         ->  PcdH2OTpmSupported                         TPM_SUPPORT(Removed)
#; PcdTpm2Supported                        ->  PcdH2OTpm2Supported                        TPM2_SUPPORT(Removed)
#; PcdConsoleRedirectionSupported          ->  PcdH2OConsoleRedirectionSupported          CONSOLE_REDIRECTION_SUPPORT(Removed)
#; PcdSeamlessUsbSupported                 ->  PcdH2OUsbSupported                         SEAMLESS_USB_SUPPORT(Removed)
#; PcdSeamlessSdhcSupported                ->  PcdH2OSdhcSupported                        SEAMLESS_SDHC_SUPPORT(Removed)
#; PcdSeamlessSdMmcSupported               ->  PcdH2OSdhcExternalCardSupported            (None)
#; PcdSeamlessEmmcSupported                ->  PcdH2OSdhcEmmcSupported                    (None)
#; PcdInsydeDebugger                       ->  PcdH2ODdtSupported                         INSYDE_DEBUGGER
#; PcdWindowsUefiFirmwareUpdateSupported   ->  PcdH2OCapsuleUpdateSupported               (None)
#; PcdH2OLocalMetroDESupported             ->  PcdH2OFormBrowserLocalMetroDESupported     (None)
#; PcdH2OLocalTextDESupported              ->  PcdH2OFormBrowserLocalTextDESupported      (None)
#;
#; Meanwhile SDHC driver is updated for adopting new naming(PcdH2OSdhcExternalCardSupported & PcdH2OSdhcEmmcSupported).
#; (This version of Seamless SDHC will be labeled as 02.12.24.0616)
#;      SDHC  DXE  : 02.12.24.0616
#;      SDHC  PEI  : 02.12.24.0616
#;      SDMMC DXE  : 02.12.22.0530
#;      SDMMC PEI  : 02.12.22.0530

#; Tag#: 05.04.23
#; Issue#: IB02960646
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: CSM
#; Symptom: (ITS: 0032022) In BayTrail V T CR CRB, Boot type still has ''Legacy Boot type'' option under SCU. But System can't boot to DOS.
#; RootCause: BayTrail V T CR CRB doesn't support CSM, so this platform should not have Legacy boot type and Dual boot type in SCU.
#; Description: Add PcdH2OCsmSupported PCD and the default value of this PCD is true. Following is the effect of this PCD:
#;              (1) PcdH2OCsmSupported is TRUE: System supports three boot types - UEFI boot, Dual boot and legacy boot. CSM will be built to BIOS.
#;              (2) PcdH2OCsmSupported is FALSE: System only supports UEFI boot. CSM will not be built to BIOS.
#; Solution: Add PcdH2OCsmSupported PCD to control CSM support.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB12740000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\InsydeModulePkg.dec
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Library\SetupUtilityLib\Boot\BootVfr.vfr

#; Issue#: IB12740049
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: SDHC
#; Symptom: System hangs with heavy IO load of eEMMC device.
#; RootCause: The "Block Count Enabled" bit of host controller was not set while transmitting a single block data, in which case the controller and card will do an "infinite transfer".
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; (This version of Seamless SDHC will be labeled as 02.12.21.0523)
#;      SDHC  DXE  : 02.12.21.0523
#;      SDHC  PEI  : 02.12.21.0523

#;      SDMMC PEI  : 02.12.07.0219
#;      SdLegacy   : 02.12.14.0402
#; Solution: Set "Block Count Enabled" bit when transmitting a single block data.
#; SolutionDependency: (None)

#; Issue#: IB02960642
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: Code Policy
#; Symptom: (ITS:0031578)[Source override] For reducing system decompress time, BayTrail CRB need override PlatformStage2NotifyCallback.c file.
#; RootCause: MemoryDiscoveredPpiNotifyPlatformStage2Callback () always creates FV HOB for FvMain. But in BayTrail CRB, it need create another FvMain HOB with hash value. In this case, system has two HOB for FvMain and need decompress two FV.
#; Description: (Feature Enhancement)
#; Solution: Move Build FV HOB related code to UpdateBootMode () and only need build FV HOB if the return status of OemSvcBootModeCreateFv function is EFI_MEDIA_CHANGED.
#; SolutionDependency: None

#; Tag#: 05.04.21
#; Issue#: IB02040400
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: ACPI
#; Symptom: (New Feature)
#; RootCause: (New Feature)
#; Description: (ITS:0031402/0031517) AcpiS3Ready doesn't provide common interface for create/update S3 resume memory related parameters to compliant with individual chipset RC. Create new chipset services "UpdateAcpiVariableSet" to let chipset layer able to customize related code to compliant with individual chipset RC. Please refer InsydeH2O Chipset Services Technical Reference 101 May272014.docx in P:\Engineering\Kernel\Core\H2O 5.0 for detail
#; Solution: (New Feature)
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB01830000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Added:

#; Issue#: IB02040406
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: LegacyBios
#; Symptom: System hang on POST code 0x31 when plugged PCIe SSD A110 card under dual/legacy boot mode
#; RootCause: Unlock legacy region failed due to zero length parameter passed to the function as the MaxRuntimeImageLength value in PCI Oprom header is set to zero
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Use Oprom ImageSize instead of RuntimImageLength to be the parameter of Unlock legacy region if it is zero

#; Issue#: IB11420054
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: Shell
#; Symptom: (ITS:0031645) UEFI Shell hangs when -b used with command.
#; RootCause: EDK2 Shell modifies the value of SimpleTextOut mode data which is the member of ConSplitter Private Data.
#;            As a result, CursorRow and CurColumn will be repeatedly incremented and then cursor position is out of
#;            screen buffer range which causes OutputString corrupting data and then causes system hang.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)

#; Issue#: IB02960641
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: SCT
#; Symptom: (1) HII_CONFIG_ROUTING_PROTOCOL.ConfigToBlock - ConfigToBlock() returns EFI_DEVICE_ERROR if Block is not large enough.
#;          (2) RANDOM_NAME_PROTOCOL.GetInfo - GetInfo() returns EFI_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL with small RNGAlgorithmListSize and returns valid size
#; RootCause: (1) ConfigBlock() should return EFI_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL if input buffer size isn't large enough, but it returns EFI_DEVICE_ERROR.
#;            (2) The definition GetInfo() and GetRNG () don't follow EFI specification.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: (1) Return EFI_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL in ConfigBlock() if input buffer size is too small.
#;           (2) According to EFI specification to correct GetInfo() and GetRNG ().
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07240000

#; Issue#: IB11420053
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: PCI
#; Symptom: (ITS:0031576) [Source override] Fix system plug Express LAN Card with DuckBay3, it will hang on CP 13.
#; RootCause: When reading Expansion ROM Header, Realtek express LAN Card on DuckBay has
#;            no responding to Byte access or Word access. Also, DuckBay with Realtek
#;            express LAN card causes system hang while running BroadWell or ChiefRiver DemoBios.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: To avoid this type of device issue, use the width of DWord read to access Expansion ROM Header.

#; Category: IHISI
#; Symptom: Potential issue: system generates #GP during flashing BIOS
#; RootCause: The procedure use MOVAPS Opcode to pass the VendorGuid argument.

#; Tag#: 05.04.19
#; Issue#: IB09740080
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Console Redirection
#; Symptom: System may hangup if press ESC sequence key(ex : ESC + 2) continuously and quickly in post phase.
#; RootCause: In UART ISR, the interrupt be enabled by trigger INT9 ISR and it causes UART ISR nest trigger.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Don't trigger INT9 ISR in UART ISR to make sure interrupt was disabled.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB09740000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeCrPkg\CrHookDxe\CrHook.c

#; Issue#: IB02040395
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: LegacyBios
#; Symptom: (ITS:31473) [Source override] RAID OPROM is not loaded when ECP_FLAG = YES on Intel Broadwell platform
#; RootCause: Originally the installation of RAID OPROM is done by Intel RC(SataController), so LegacyBios driver is skip it in purposely. However the Intel RC on Broadwell is no longer installing RAID OPROM, it will causing lack of installing RAID OPROM on both of SataController and LegacyBios
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution:
#;   1. For RAID OPROM installation, remove RAID OPROM skipping code in LegacyBios driver to make RAID OPROM can be installed by either LegacyBios or SataController driver(if using older Intel RC)
#;   2. For the issue of not enough EBDA region size for Broadwell RAID OPROM, solved by IB02040394(by PCD customization)
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB08520000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Csm\LegacyBiosDxe\LegacyPci.c

#; Issue#: IB02040394
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: LegacyBios
#; Symptom: (ITS:31403) [Source override] The EBDA region size is too small to Intel RAID OPROM and cause system hang during OPROM running
#; RootCause: The original EBDA region size is hard coded and not enough for larger OPROM
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Utilize existing PcdEbdaReservedMemorySize(default 0x18000) for EBDA region size customization, also utilize existing PcdOpromReservedMemoryBase(default 0x60000) and PcdOpromReservedMemorySize(default 0x28000) for OPROM reserved memory base/size customization
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB01780000
#; RelatedFiles:

#; Tag#: 05.04.17
#; Issue#: IB02040391
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom: Restart long run hang during POST if press any key repeatedly by USB keyboard plugged in USB 3.0 port
#; RootCause: The key released SMI triggered after periodic timer provider moved from XHCI to lower speed HC and causing periodic timer interrupt being double freed and make the memory corruption
#; Description:  This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.02.17.0423
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.02.17.0421
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.02.05.0127
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.02.05.0127
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.02.17.0423
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.02.14.0331
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.01.50.1213
#; Solution: Add check code to preventing periodic timer interrupt from double freed
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02040000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\Arm\XhciDxe.efi

#; Tag#: 05.04.17
#; Issue#: IB02040390
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom: Unable to detected USB 2.0 devices plugged in USB 3.0 port on AMD platforms after adopt IB02040381 at 05.04.13
#; RootCause: The AMD chipset RC will clear XHCI port status changed bit in PORTSC upon OS owned semaphore changed event which used for XHCI SMI test procedure during XHCI initial phase and causing subsequently device enumeration procedure skipped the device
#; Description:  This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.02.17.0422
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.02.17.0421
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.02.05.0127
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.02.05.0127
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.02.17.0422
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.02.14.0331
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.01.50.1213
#; Solution: Added XHCI VID check statement to make the pre-port-reset procedure(for IB02040381) only apply on Intel XHCI host controller
#; SolutionDependency: IB02040390 fixed the side effect by IB02040381 (Adopted in 05.04.13)
#; Reviewer: IB02040000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\Arm\XhciDxe.efi
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\Ia32\XhciDxe.efi
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\X64\XhciDxe.efi
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\XhciDxe.inf

#; Tag#: 05.04.17
#; Issue#: IB02040389
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom: USB 2.0 keyboard unable to be detected under Intel SIMICS
#; RootCause:
#;   1. The incorrect detection of line status J/K state in EHCI PORTSC make the device enumeration procedure report wrong device speed and causing device unable to be detected
#;   2. The BIOS owned semaphores bit in legacy support register cleared by SMIMCS and causing SMI testing routine  failed to detect SMI. This is Intel SIMICS special behavior
#; Description:  This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.02.17.0421
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.02.17.0421
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.02.05.0127
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.02.05.0127
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.02.17.0421
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.02.14.0331
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.01.50.1213
#; Solution:
#;   1. Adjust the EHCI GetRootHubPortStatus on device speed identification code to preventing potential error on some high speed device
#;   2. Adjust the setting of OS and BIOS owned semaphore bit in legacy support register to recover the clearing of BIOS owned semaphore bit
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02040000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\Arm\EhciDxe.efi
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\EhciDxe.inf
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\Ia32\EhciDxe.efi
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\X64\EhciDxe.efi
#;   5. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\Arm\XhciDxe.efi
#;   6. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\Ia32\XhciDxe.efi
#;   7. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\X64\XhciDxe.efi
#;   8. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\XhciDxe.inf
#;
#; Tag#: 05.04.17
#; Issue#: IB07240258
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: SCU
#; Symptom: Using "Boot From File" to select EFI shell from USB results in corrupt video display.
#; RootCause: Using "Boot From File" to select EFI shell makes screen mode change. It makes private BLT buffer of setup mouse is too small and result in memory overflow.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)

#; Category: CSM
#; Symptom: SCU page flipping doesn't smoothly when using PS2 keyboard and press direction key repeatedly on AMD platforms under dual/legacy boot type

#; Tag#: 05.04.16
#; Issue#: IB07240256
#; Severity: Feature
#; Category: Kernel
#; Symptom: (Code Enhancement)
#; RootCause: (Code Enhancement)
#; Description: 1. Move the extern declaration of auto generated array data of SetupUtilityLib from SetupUtility.h to SetupUtilityLib.h
#;              2. Remove input parameter HiiHandle of HOT_KEY_CALLBACK to make that SetupUtilityLib does not need to input HII handle of SetupUtilityDxe driver.
#;              3. Enhance getting VFR variable store size function which has better performance and can assign specific variable store GUID.
#;              4. Use common EFI_CALLBACK_INFO_FROM_THIS for each setup menu callback info.
#;              5. Free some allocated memory when the caller no longer requires the contents of memory
#; Solution: (Code Enhancement)
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02960000

#; Tag#: 05.04.14
#; Issue#: IB02040387
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom: System hang during restart/S4 long run test on new generation of AMD platform
#; RootCause: As AMD platform using single SMI pin for both of EHCI and XHCI, the system will fall into situation when EHCI SMI triggered upon OS XHCI driver initial, it will make XHCI SMI handler refer an invalid BAR value and caused system hang
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.02.15.0407
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.02.05.0127
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.02.05.0127
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.02.05.0127
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.02.15.0407
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.02.14.0331
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.01.50.1213
#; Solution: Add invalid BAR checking routine to preventing XHCI SMI handler from using invalid BAR value
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02040000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\Arm\XhciDxe.efi
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\Ia32\XhciDxe.efi

#; Tag#: 05.04.14
#; Issue#: IB02040386
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Keyboard
#; Symptom: (ITS:30990) PS2 keyboard stop response when pressing direction key repeatedly in SCU on Intel Sharkbay/Broadwell/Baytrail-M platform
#; RootCause:
#;   1. The KBC unable to prepare correct key code in time if the gap between accessing status and data port too close
#;   2. The KBC polling interval too large and causing PS2 keyboard driver unable to get correct scan code in time due to KBC internal data buffer full
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution:
#;   1. Add delay between the accessing of KBC status and data port to make KBC has enough time to prepare correct scan code in the data port
#;   2. Increase timer interval from 18.2 to 100 per second and remove redundancy stall to make KBC polling handler able to get correct scan code in time
#;   3. Rollback IB02960626 and IB02960584 to reduce the complexity of solution
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02960000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Isa\Ps2KeyboardDxe\Ps2KbdCtrller.c
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Isa\Ps2KeyboardDxe\Ps2Keyboard.h
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Csm\BiosThunk\KeyboardDxe\BiosKeyboard.c
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Csm\Legacy16\096\Legacy16.bin
#;   5. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\BdsDxe\Bds.h
#;   6. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\BdsDxe\BdsDxe.inf
#;   7. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\BdsDxe\BdsEntry.c
#;

#; Issue#: IB02960634
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: Memory
#; Symptom: (ITS: 0031528) In some platforms, system may hang while booting to UEFI Ubuntu (13.10 x64) OS.
#; RootCause: SmmDxePcdLib creates gEfiEventVirtualAddressChangeGuid event without checking image type, it may cause system hang if image type isn't EfiRuntimeServicesCode.
#; Description: (Bug Fixed)
#; Solution: Only create gEfiEventVirtualAddressChangeGuid event if image type is EfiRuntimeServicesCode.
#; SolutionDependency: IB02960634 fixes side effect of IB05670241 (Adopted in 05.04.11)
#; Reviewer: IB07240000
#; RelatedFiles:

#; Description: Remove EFI_OEM_FORM_BROWSER2_PROTOCOL protocol and add H2O_DIALOG_PROTOCOL to be compatible with H2O 5.0 Setup.
#;              Following is the corresponding functions usage between EFI_OEM_FORM_BROWSER2_PROTOCOL and H2O_DIALOG_PROTOCOL:
#;              {old function call                            , new function call                    }
#;              {EFI_OEM_FORM_BROWSER2_PROTOCOL.CreatePopUp   , H2O_DIALOG_PROTOCOL.ConfirmDialog    }
#;              {EFI_OEM_FORM_BROWSER2_PROTOCOL.DialogIcon    , H2O_DIALOG_PROTOCOL.PasswordDialog   }

#; Tag#: 05.04.11
#; Issue#: IB12740044
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: SDHC
#; Symptom: eMMC device can't be detected when PcdSeamlessEmmcSupported = TRUE.
#; RootCause: The driver binary can't get the value of PcdSeamlessEmmcSupported dynamically since the type of PcdSeamlessEmmcSupported is PcdsDynamic not PcdsDynamicEx.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Correct the PCD type of PcdSeamlessEmmcSupported to PcdsDynamicEx.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02960000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:

#; Tag#: 05.04.11
#; Issue#: IB07880097
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: SATA
#; Symptom: System boots to wrong HDD when connecting two HDDs to Toshiba RAID card.
#; RootCause: BIOS can find only one device via PnP expansion header in ROM image and physical drive number is filled in according to
#;            total drive number. Thus, BIOS will always boot to the HDD other than the selected HDD.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: If drive number derived from PnP expansion header in ROM image is less than actual total drive number, duplicating BBS entry
#;           so that all HDDs can be recognized.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB05670000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Csm\BiosThunk\BlockIoDxe\BiosBlkIo.c
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Csm\BiosThunk\BlockIoDxe\BiosBlkIo.h

#; Tag#: 05.04.11
#; Issue#: IB09740069
#; Severity: Tweak
#; Category: Console Redirection
#; Symptom: (Code adjustment)
#; RootCause: (Code adjustment)
#; Description: Update C.R. feature drivers as binary format. This version of C.R. features will be labeled as 10.01
#;   CrBiosFlashDxe    : 10.01
#;   CrDdtCableDxe     : 10.01

#; Issue#: IB02040379
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom: (ITS:31050) The Toshiba McKinley wireless UK keyboard abnormal under Shell/Dos, The [Shift] key always in pressed state when press any key
#; RootCause: Due to currently keyboard driver only support "boot" protocol and mouse driver only support "report" protocol, and this device unable to support different protocol(boot/report) apply to each of interfaces as it has keyboard on interface 0 and mouse on interface 1. This is device firmware issue
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.02.11.0312
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.02.05.0127
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.02.05.0127
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.02.05.0127
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.02.03.0117
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.01.25.0619
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.01.50.1213
#; Solution: Changed the mouse driver to use "boot" protocol as default and set to "report" protocol if this mouse device doesn't support "boot" protocol. This is used to workaround this device firmware weakness to make it set to same "boot" protocol on both of keyboard and mouse interfaces
#; SolutionDependency: None

#; RelatedFiles:

#; Tag#: 05.04.10
#; Issue#: IB11420047
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: PCI
#; Symptom: Imagraph PCIe_x4 VGA card can not be discovered on ChiefRiver platform only when another
#;          PCIe_x1 card inserted in the particular slot.
#; RootCause: Once bus number has been configured, this card needs to capture bus number information by
#;            sending a configuration write. if not doing so, this card can not be discovered.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: During the execution of PciScanBus function in PciBusDriver, send a configuration write
#;           to the device in order to recapture the bus number.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02040000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:

#; Issue#: IB07240241
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: RTC
#; Symptom: (ITS:0031031) In SharkBay (HSW+LPT) platform, set time to 2099/12/31 23:59:59 by IRU in Win 8 OS. It will lag seriously when time automatically change to 2100/1/1.
#; RootCause: EFI_RUNTIME_SERVICES.GetTime() function will return EFI_DEVICE_ERROR when year value of time is bigger than 2100.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Change valid year value from [2000,2099] to [1900,9999] to follow UEFI spec for time service functions of EFI runtime service.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02960000
#; RelatedFiles:

#; Category: CSM
#; Symptom: System hang on DOS booting(POST code 0xfd) after updated IB02040355 solution

#; Tag#: 05.04.06
#; Issue#: IB02040374
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom: (ITS:0030609) Sometimes USB mass storage plug in VIA USB 3.0 HUB unable to be detected during POST
#; RootCause:
#;   1. The firmware of VIA HUB controller response time too slow on responding HUB port power-on procedure, it will causing HUB stop response the ACK after port power-on command.
#;   2. VIA USB 3.0 HUB controller needs up to 3 seconds stall after port power-on to able to well recognize the downstream port device
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.02.05.0128
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.02.05.0127
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.02.05.0127
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.02.05.0127
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.02.03.0117
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.01.25.0619
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.01.50.1213
#; Solution:
#;   1. Insert 1 millisecond stall between HUB port power-on command if it is VIA HUB
#;   2. Change the HUB table to make whole VIA HUB needs to stall 3 seconds after port power-on
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02040000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbBusDxe\Hub.c
#;
#; Tag#: 05.04.06
#; Issue#: IB02040373
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom: (ITS:0030354) Sometimes USB flash drive will lost in Boot Manager when plug in USB3.0 HUB
#; RootCause: EHCI/OHCI/UHCI periodic SMI in conflict with USB 3.0 HUB device between the time frame of device reset to device configuration due to device address conflict
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.02.05.0127
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.02.05.0127
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.02.05.0127
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.02.05.0127
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.02.03.0117

#; Tag#: 05.04.04
#; Issue#: IB07390126
#; Severity: Tweak
#; Category: SMBIOS
#; Symptom: (Code Adjustment)
#; RootCause: (Code Adjustment)
#; Description: 1. Provide a new OEM service -- OemSvcDxeGetSmbiosReplaceString. OEM can use it to implement a OEM
#;                 dependence method to replace string like DMI Tool.
#;              2. Add a PCD PcdSmbiosStringFieldOffset to contain all string field offset for each type. So SMBIOS
#;                 driver can set string's field to zero when receive an empty string.
#;              3. Change PCD name from PcdSmbiosRenewableStringTable to PcdSmbiosUpdatableStringTable
#; Solution: (Code Adjustment)
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB06720000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Added:
#;   1. InsydeOemServicesPkg\Library\DxeOemSvcKernelLib\OemSvcDxeGetSmbiosReplaceString.c
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\InsydeModulePkg.dec
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Package.dsc
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Smbios\PnpRuntimeDxe\PnpRuntimeDxe.c

#; Tag#: 05.04.03
#; Issue#: IB05670222
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Build
#; Symptom: Build process fails if the value of a VOID* type PCD contains characters such as '|', ',' in an ASCII or UNICODE represented string.
#; RootCause: The PCD statement preprocessor does not ignore the specific delimiters inside a string when splits the PCD statements or PCD values.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Update PCD preprocessor to ignore delimiters inside a string
#; SolutionDependency: The issue might happen if a PCD value is represented in a new VOID * type PCD representation introduced by IB05670212 (adopted at 05.03.47)
#; Reviewer: IB11590000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. BaseTools\Bin\Win32\GenFds.exe
#;   2. BaseTools\Bin\Win32\build.exe

#; Tag#: 05.04.03
#; Issue#: IB02040371
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom: System long run hang upon legacy boot on the platform with whole USB host controllers are non SMI capable
#; RootCause: The LegacyFreeHcTimerEvent timer polling keep triggered after legacy boot address patching procedure, it will make the timer handler refer an address patched linking list and cause CPU exception
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.02.03.0119
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.02.03.0117
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.02.03.0117
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.02.03.0117
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.02.03.0117
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.01.25.0619
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.01.50.1213
#; Solution: Close LegacyFreeHcTimerEvent timer event before legacy boot address patching procedure
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02040000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbCoreDxe\UsbCoreDxe.c
#;
#; Tag#: 05.04.03

#; RootCause: The USB ignored table doesn't capable to be reinstalled
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.02.03.0118
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.02.03.0117
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.02.03.0117
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.02.03.0117
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.02.03.0117
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.01.25.0619
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.01.50.1213

#; Issue#: IB02040369
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: LegacyBios
#; Symptom: The "USB boot" may not take effect when it is disabled in SCU
#; RootCause: The returned parameter USB_LEGACY_MODIFIERS in UsbLegacyBiosPlatform->GetUsbPlatformOptions function will only capable to "set", can't "clear", some of bits may incorrectly if the USB_LEGACY_MODIFIERS buffer doesn't get cleared before calling
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Clear USB_LEGACY_MODIFIERS buffer before calling UsbLegacyBiosPlatform->GetUsbPlatformOptions to make sure the corresponding bit correctly
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02040000

#; Modified:

#; Tag#: 05.04.03
#; Issue#: IB02040367
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom: The USB policy "UEFI only" option doesn't take effect on H2O 5.0
#; RootCause: The USB policy code miss sync with H2O 3.7 in IB02040280 at 03.62.28
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.02.03.0117
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.02.03.0117
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.02.03.0117
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.02.03.0117
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.02.03.0117
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.01.25.0619
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.01.50.1213
#; Solution: Sync the code with H2O 3.7
#; SolutionDependency: IB02040367 fixed the side effect of IB02040280 at 05.02.28
#; Reviewer: IB02040000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\Arm\EhciDxe.efi

#;   6. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\OhciDxe\Ia32\OhciDxe.efi
#;   7. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\OhciDxe\OhciDxe.inf
#;   8. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\OhciDxe\X64\OhciDxe.efi

#; Issue#: IB02960612
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Variable
#; Symptom: IHISI function 01 cannot delete variable if variable attribute isn't EFI_VARIABLE_NON_VOLATILE | EFI_VARIABLE_BOOTSERVICE_ACCESS | EFI_VARIABLE_RUNTIME_ACCESS.
#; RootCause: IHISI function 01 always use EFI_VARIABLE_NON_VOLATILE | EFI_VARIABLE_BOOTSERVICE_ACCESS | EFI_VARIABLE_RUNTIME_ACCESS to set variable and it will cause delete variable failed if preexisting variable attribute isn't EFI_VARIABLE_NON_VOLATILE | EFI_VARIABLE_BOOTSERVICE_ACCESS | EFI_VARIABLE_RUNTIME_ACCESS.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Change IHISI function 01 to use attribute is 0 to delete variable.
#; SolutionDependency: IB02960612 is related to IB02960582 (adopted in 05.03.46)
#; Reviewer: IB07240000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Library\IhisiLib\VatsLib.c

#; Issue#: IB02040366
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom: Unable to detected Ultra-X USB thumb drive during POST
#; RootCause:
#;   1. Unable to recognize upon system cold boot : This is unsolvable and the symptom also happened on OS
#;   2. Unable to recognize upon system warm boot : This is device firmware issue due to it is wrongly report the "last" block number to "total" block number(so the correct value needed to be "total" block number V 1)
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.01.50.1213
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.01.41.1007
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.01.25.0617
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.01.25.0617
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.01.50.1212
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.01.25.0619
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.01.50.1213
#; Solution: Adjust the UsbLegacy code to having workaround to read last sector by "total" block number - 1
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02040000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Csm\UsbLegacySmm\Ia32\UsbLegacySmm.efi
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Csm\UsbLegacySmm\UsbLegacySmm.inf
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Csm\UsbLegacySmm\X64\UsbLegacySmm.efi
#;
#; Tag#: 05.03.50
#; Issue#: IB02040365
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom: System hang during POST when plugged USB 3.0 add-on card on server platform
#; RootCause: Not enough PCIe bridge(use for record the power state registers) number setting in Xhci driver and causing memory corruption
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.01.50.1212
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.01.41.1007
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.01.25.0617
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.01.25.0617
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.01.50.1212
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.01.25.0619
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.01.47.1123
#; Solution: Enlarge the number of PCIe bridge from 4 to 8 to satisfy server platform usage
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02040000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\Arm\XhciDxe.efi

#; Issue#: IB07880096
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: SATA
#; Symptom: On Grantley platform, when one SATA controller is set to IDE mode and another is set to AHCI mode, SMM AtaPassThru protocol
#;          in AhciBusDxe is not installed.
#; RootCause: AhciBusDxe locates AtaPassThru protocol installed by IdeBusDxe first and then aborts procedure.
#; Description: 1.(Bug Fix)
#;              2.(This version of Seamless SATA will be labeled as 02.01.49.1210.00)
#;                 AhciBusDxe: 02.01.49.1210.00
#;                 IdeBusDxe: 02.01.49.1210.00
#;                 AhciBusPei: 02.00.41.1016.00
#;                 IdeBusPei: 02.01.41.1015.00
#;                 AtaLegacySmm: 02.01.39.1001.00
#;                 StorageSecurityCommandDxe: 02.01.03.0122
#; Solution: If more than one AtaPassThru protocol is located, AhciBusDxe continues to examine next one.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB08520000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\AhciBusDxe\AhciBusDxe.inf

#; Tag#: 05.03.47
#; Issue#: IB11420038
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Graphics
#; Symptom: Hot plug USB-To-Serial terminal device causes other console's text contents to be cleared.
#; RootCause: When USB-To-Serial terminal device is added or deleted, Consplitter driver
#;            recalculates intersections and then always sets text mode.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: When new added console output device supports other console's current text mode,
#;           text contents will be updated to the new console. However, if new console does not
#;           support current text mode, then new text mode will be set, which means that screen will
#;           be cleared.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07240000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:

#; Symptom: (New Feature)
#; RootCause: (New Feature)
#; Description: Rework SDHC DXE driver. Please refer to "P:\Engineering\Kernel\Core\InsydeH2O Features Guide\InsydeH2O 50 Seamless SDHC Technical Reference.docx" for details.
#;              This solution has the following features:
#;              1. Supports access to external SDSC/SDHC/SDXC/MMC cards
#;              2. Supports access to eMMC device

#;              4. Ability to access the external cards in legacy OS (DOS)
#;              Limitations:
#;              Some features are not implemented in this version:

#; Symptom: Using "keyinstaller tool" to backup secure key from variable area to factory copy area fails.

#; Tag#: 05.03.46
#; Issue#: IB07240212
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: BDS
#; Symptom: (ITS:0029309) System always update MTC and ConIn variables every POST.
#; RootCause: (1) System always update the monotonic counter into MTC variable every POST.
#;            (2) At first boot, BDS will initialize ConIn variable by adding device paths of PS2 keyboard and mouse.
#;                But these two device paths will connect fail then be deleted from ConIn variable. It makes system always do ConIn variable initialization every POST.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: (1) Add PCD "PcdSetMtcToCmos" to determine whether save the monotonic counter into CMOS or save it in MTC variable.
#;               Default value of this PCD is TRUE. System will save the monotonic counter in CMOS and the value of MTC variable is always zero.
#;           (2) Remove the process of adding device paths of PS2 keyboard and mouse into ConIn variable.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02960000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Added:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\MonotonicCounterRuntimeDxe\
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\MonotonicCounterRuntimeDxe\MonotonicCounter.c
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\MonotonicCounterRuntimeDxe\MonotonicCounterRuntimeDxe.inf

#; Issue#: IB02960584
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Keyboard
#; Symptom: (ITS 0028591) In sharkbay ULT or broadwell CRB and SIRQ mode is continuous mode, the PS2 keyboard stops working after a few key pressing in the SCU of legacy boot.
#; RootCause: In some chipsets and  serial IRQ mode is continuous mode, data is written to KBC data port may not trigger IRQ1 and it will cause IRQ1 will not be triggered again.

#; Issue#: IB02040355
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: CSM
#; Symptom: System hang during DOS reset long run on Intel Sharkbay ULT CRB with dual/legacy boot mode
#; RootCause: The KBC on Intel Sharkbay ULT unable to suffer the short timing gap on two adjacent KBC status port reading operation
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Add IO_DELAY in the KBC status port polling loop of WaitInputEmpty and WaitOutputFull subroutine to enlarge the timing gap of two adjacent KBC status port reading operation
#; SolutionDependency: None

#; Issue#: IB02960579
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Keyboard
#; Symptom: If Using "Del" key as hot key to enter setup utility and boot mode is "dual boot" mode, user presses "Delete" key in USB keyboard during POST cannot enter Setup Utility ("Del" key in key pad is work).
#; RootCause: USB keyboard converts the scan code of "Delete" key from double code (0xe0, 0x53) to single code (0xd3) for monitor key. This behavior will cause the monitor key value for "Del" (0x53) and "Delete" (0xd3) key is different.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Synchronize CSM16 policy to convert double code for monitor key.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02040000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Smbus\I2cKbDxe\I2cKeyboard.c

#; Tag#: 05.03.45
#; Issue#: IB02960573
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Performance
#; Symptom: (ITS: 0028131) If the PS2 connector does not plug-in any devices in Mahobay_Apac CRB, the PS2 module "Ps2Keyboard" is more then 4 seconds.
#; RootCause: 1. If PS2 connector doesn't plug-in any device and try to read BAT test result, it will return KBC self test OK (0x55) not BAT test OK (0xAA). In this situation, waiting for BAT test OK will spend about 1 second and return EFI_TIMEOUT.
#;            2. If PS2 connector doesn't plug-in keyboard and try to send LED write command to KBC data port, it will return cannot provide acknowledgment (0xFE) not acknowledgment of previous data (0xFA). In this situation, waiting for acknowledgment of previous data will spend about 3 seconds and return EFI_TIMEOUT.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Add KeyboardWaitForValues () to waiting for KBC self test OK (0x55) and BAT test OK data (0xAA).
#;           2. Add KeyboardWaitForValues () to waiting for cannot provide acknowledgment (0xFE) and acknowledgment of previous data (0xFA)
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02700000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Isa\Ps2KeyboardDxe\Ps2KbdCtrller.c
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Isa\Ps2KeyboardDxe\Ps2Keyboard.h
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Csm\BiosThunk\KeyboardDxe\BiosKeyboard.c
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Csm\BiosThunk\KeyboardDxe\BiosKeyboard.h
#;

#; Issue#: IB07990107
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Network
#; Symptom: Boot PXE (IPv4/IPv6) will hang in some IPv6 network environment.
#; RootCause: 1.When IPv6 router assign the route addresses to NIC card, EfiDhcp6InfoRequest function doesn't initialize client ID, it will cause memory crash.
#;            2.Driver always allocate incorrect memory size for DUID selector, when the number of DUID selector is more than 2, it will cause memory crash.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Check if initialize client ID in Dhcp6InfoRequest function.
#;           2. Adjust the NETWORK_STACK_DHCP6_DUID_SELECTOR structure.
#; SolutionDependency: IB07990107 fixes side effect of IB07990099 (Adopted in 05.03.17)

#; Tag#: 05.03.44
#; Issue#: IB08520088
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: HDD Password
#; Symptom: When resetting master HDD password, there is no item to confirm original master HDD password.
#; RootCause: Original policy didn't support to confirm original HDD master password before changing or disabling.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Change master HDD password confirming policy to avoid security hole.
#;           Add PASSWORD_CONFIGURATION structure to record the status of behavior changed.
#;           For the details, please refer to "P:\Engineering\Kernel\Core\Security\Password\HddPassword_SCU_BehaviorChanged.pdf"
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07880000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Include\KernelSetupConfig.h
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Include\Library\SetupUtilityLib.h
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Library\SetupUtilityLib\Security\Password.c

#; Tag#: 05.03.43
#; Issue#: IB09740054
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Console Redirection
#; Symptom: CROpROM initial fail.
#; RootCause: In CROpROM initial stage, TerminalScreenRefresh task been executed before MonitorVga Module initial.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: TerminalScreenRefresh was base on context of MonitorVga Module to access EBDA space.
#;           If TerminalScreenRefresh get wrong information from MonitorVga module, it will cause
#;           EBDA space been damaged and CROpROM initial fail.
#;           Execute TerminalScreenRefresh task after MonitorVga initial.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB09740000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Csm\ConsoleRedirection\ConsoleRedirection.bin

#; Tag#: 05.03.43
#; Issue#: IB11420037
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Graphics
#; Symptom: In Dual/Legacy mode and plug VGA card, SCU is not displayed fast enough
#; RootCause: When Blt operation EfiBltVideoToBltBuffer is selected,
#;            reading display data from vga frame buffer causes performance bottleneck.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: When Blt operation EfiBltVideoToBltBuffer is selected,
#;           read display data from memory buffer instead of vga frame buffer.
#;           In addition, in order to let virtual keyboard work properly in BitLocker environment,
#;           memory buffer will be switched to vga framebuffer after ReadyToBoot. It is due to
#;           Window writes data directly to vga framebuffer.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07010000

#; Tag#: 05.03.42
#; Issue#: IB08340138
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: Security
#; Symptom: When MEMORY_SIZE_FOR_RESERVED is set to 9MB, the verification of secure flash is failed in some platforms.
#; RootCause: The system will reboot twice in Secure Flash process on some platforms.
#;            So, system will execute SecureFlashPei twice, and copy image data to the reserved memory space twice.
#;            If these two memories are overlapped, wrong data are copied to the reserved memory.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Always allocate the same size(MEMORY_SIZE_FOR_RESERVED) for the reserved memory.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB05670000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Security\SecureFlash\SecureFlashPei\SecureFlashPei.c

#; Tag#: 05.03.41
#; Issue#: IB02960569
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: EFI_DEBUG
#; Symptom: (ITS:0028663) If secure boot is enabled and EFI_DEBUG is enabled, sometimes system will be asserted during POST.
#; RootCause: StrLen () in BaseLib will check Unicode string must be 2-byte alignment, but variable is 1-byte alignment. It will be asserted if variable name isn't 2-byte alignment.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Override BaseLib library to do following changes:
#;           1. Don't check Unicode string must be 2-byte alignment in StrLen (), StrCpy () and StrnCpy ().
#;           2. Change to only invoke ASSERT macro if string length is large than PcdMaximumUnicodeStringLength in StrLen () to improve performance in EFI debug mode.
#;           3. Change to only invoke ASSERT macro if string length is large than PcdMaximumAsciiStringLength in AsciiStrLen () to improve performance in EFI debug mode.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07240000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Added:
#;   1. MdePkg\Override\
#;   2. MdePkg\Override\Library\
#;   3. MdePkg\Override\Library\BaseLib\
#;   4. MdePkg\Override\Library\BaseLib\String.c
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\InsydeModulePkg.dsc
#;   2. MdePkg\Package.dsc
#;

#; Tag#: 05.03.41
#; Issue#: IB12740025
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: TPM
#; Symptom: WHCK "TPM 2.0 - Supplemental test" - fail.
#; RootCause: SmmBase related images from main FV were measured into PCR[02]. The TPM driver
#;            can't recognize where the SmmBase related images come from since SmmBase driver
#;            loads the images directly from FV without giving filepath.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: According to TCG EFI Platform specification, PCR[02] is for the EFI drivers loaded
#;           from adapter cards, external storage media, or Option ROM.
#;           Assuming that all the images in DXE phase are valid, and measuring the PE images only loaded
#;           in BDS phase.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02960000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Library\DxeTpm2MeasureBootLib\DxeTpm2MeasureBootLib.c
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Library\DxeTpm2MeasureBootLib\DxeTpm2MeasureBootLib.inf
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Library\DxeTpmMeasureBootLib\DxeTpmMeasureBootLib.c
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Library\DxeTpmMeasureBootLib\DxeTpmMeasureBootLib.inf

#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: SATA
#; Symptom: If connecting to SATA ODD with OS installation disc in it and Sandisk A110 SSD, system fails
#;          to boot to legacy OS in disc.
#; RootCause: SSD option ROM header length is 0x18 and revision is 0x3. According to PCI Firmware Spec.

#; SolutionDependency: None

#; Category: SATA
#; Symptom: System hangs at POST code 0x25 with Sandisk A110 SSD.
#; RootCause: Solution IB07880077 will attempt to initialize AHCI controller on SSD, but
#;            the SSD is designed only to be accessed via its option ROM.
#; Description: 1.(Bug Fix)
#;              2.(This version of Seamless SATA will be labeled as 02.01.41.1015.00)
#;                 AhciBusDxe: 02.01.41.1015.00
#;                 IdeBusDxe: 02.01.21.0528.00
#;                 AhciBusPei: 02.00.41.1016.00
#;                 IdeBusPei: 02.01.41.1015.00
#;                 AtaLegacySmm: 02.01.39.1001.00
#;                 StorageSecurityCommandDxe: 02.01.03.0122
#; Solution: When SSD has its own AHCI controller and option ROM, AhciBus driver won't initialize
#;           AHCI controller on SSD.
#; SolutionDependency: IB07880089 fixes side effect of IB07880077 (Adopted in 05.03.28)
#; Reviewer: IB08520000

#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Recovery
#; Symptom: Crisis recovery fails on AMD Kabini platform with Seagate SSHD.
#; RootCause: BIOS needs longer timeout to finish read command.

#;                 AhciBusDxe: 02.01.39.1001.00

#;                 AhciBusPei: 02.00.41.1016.00

#;                 AtaLegacySmm: 02.01.39.1001.00

#; Tag#: 05.03.41
#; Issue#: IB08340140
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: SMBIOS
#; Symptom: (ITS: 0027691) By using WDMI tool to update strings of SMBIOS table, if the new string size is different from the original one, BSOD occurs.
#; RootCause: The string size is changed, but the table length is not changed. The end pointer will point to a wrong address.
#;            The tool cannot get the correct last handle of SMBIOS table. Requesting SMBIOS data over and over again causes system to print the Blue Screen.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Adjust the end pointer to the correct address.
#;           2. Check if the buffer is enough for adding the new string. If the space is not enough, SMBIOS table data will not be modified.
#;              But, the new string will be added after rebooting.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB05670000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Smbios\PnpSmm\PnpDmi.c
#;
#; Tag#: 05.03.41
#; Issue#: IB07880087
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: SATA
#; Symptom: In SCU, SATA port information is not shown at port 4/5 on Legacy AHCI mode.
#; RootCause: Solution IB07880077 will examine if SATA device is onboard or not by PCI bus, device and function in BBS table.
#;            Bus, device and function are zero when port number is larger than 3, because FillHddInfo function can at most handle
#;            4 devices for each controller.
#; Description:(Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Enhance procedure to prevent limitation of 4 devices for each controller.
#;           IB07880084 (Tag 05.03.37) and IB07880086 (Tag 05.03.39) are required for this solution.
#; SolutionDependency: IB07880087 fixes side effect of IB07880077 (Adopted in 05.03.28)
#; Reviewer: IB08520000
#; RelatedFiles:

#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\CommonPolicy\LegacyBiosPlatformDxe\GetPlatformHandle.c

#; Issue#: IB02040353
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom: USB HID device malfunction on new generation of AMD legacy free platform(non-KBC and non-OHCI)
#; RootCause: The AMD CPU trap for 0x60/0x64 port is act as asynchronous mode and causing USB HC getting wrong value from corresponding SMM CPU save state
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.01.41.1007
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.01.41.1007
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.01.25.0617
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.01.25.0617
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.01.41.1007
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.01.25.0619
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.01.25.0617
#; Solution: Adding new option USB_LEGACY_CONTROL_GET_CAPABILITY(4) in UsbLegacyControl driver to indicates the CPU trap is act as asynchronous mode to make the USB HC driver change the approach of getting corresponding value upon CPU trap event triggered. Please refer P:\Engineering\Kernel\Core\USB\SeamlessUsb\SeamlessUsb Integration Guide.pdf for detail
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02040000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\Arm\EhciDxe.efi
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\EhciDxe.inf

#; Tag#: 05.03.40
#; Issue#: IB02960564
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: System Password
#; Symptom: (ITS: 0027913) If system supervisor password is set and power on password id enabled, system doesn't check pop-up dialog to check system password in recovery mode.
#; RootCause: 1. System doesn't call check password related function to do password check in recovery mode.
#;            2. The Setup data in gEfiPowerOnPwSCUHobGuid HOB always is setup default value, so it always considers power on password is disabled (default is disabled)
#;            3. In PEI phase, Some system password related HOBs aren't created in recovery mode. It will cause system password related code cannot get correct password information in recovery mode.
#;            4. System password driver doesn't try to get supervisor password related HOB in recovery mode.
#;            5. PEI GetVariable () always return EFI_NOT_FOUND in recovery mode.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Check password in recovery mode.
#;           2. Enhance SetupDefaultProvider PEIM to can provide setup default value and current setup value.
#;           3. Build all of  system password related HOBs in recovery mode.
#;           4. Check all of password related HOBs in system password driver.
#;           5. Change the GetVariable () behavior in recovery mode to same as normal boot.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB08520000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Include\Guid\SystemPasswordVariable.h
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Include\Library\VariableSupportLib.h

#;   8. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Security\SysPasswordDxe\SysPasswordDxe.h
#;   9. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Security\SysPasswordDxe\SysPasswordDxe.inf

#; Tag#: 05.03.39
#; Issue#: IB08340142
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: SMBIOS
#; Symptom: (ITS: 0028198) In platform with a big SMBIOS table, it will hang at ReadyToBoot event.
#; RootCause: In PnpRuntimeDxe.c, it allocates a buffer with a default size for SMBIOS table. A ReadyToBoot event will copy the SMBIOS data to this buffer.
#;            If the SMBIOS table size is larger than the default size, it will touch other memory.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Allocate memory for the buffer according to the actual SMBIOS table at ReadyToBoot event.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB05670000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Smbios\PnpRuntimeDxe\PnpDmi.c

#; Tag#: 05.03.38
#; Issue#: IB02960560
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: Memory
#; Symptom: (ITS:00028051) System sometimes will hang on 0x83 after system shutdown during POST by remove AC.
#; RootCause: If system remove AC when MemoeryTypeUpdateInfo variable is set and MemoryTypeInformation variable isn't set, system may set incorrect memory type information to MemoryTypeInformation variable during next POST due to arithmetic overflow cause preallocate page size to large.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Change set variable sequence to MemoryTypeInformation variable and then MemoeryTypeUpdateInfo variable, this action can prevent from setting too large page size to MemoryTypeInformation variable.
#;           2. Delete MemoryTypeInformation and MemoeryTypeUpdateInfo variable if the calculated page size is too large.
#;           3. If preallocate page size is too large, using default preallocate page size in PEI phase to prevent from system hang.
#; SolutionDependency: IB02960560 fixes the side effect of IB02960526 (Adopted in 05.03.16)
#; Reviewer: IB07240000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Library\GenericBdsLib\MemoryCheck.c
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\CommonPolicy\PlatformStage1Pei\Memory.c

#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: Build
#; Symptom: Can't find data/code right after section header of binary if this binary/driver is specified
#;          by FixedDataAddress token.
#; RootCause: Assuming always there is a raw section header follows Ffs header of binary.
#;            And always add 4 byte pad between section header and data to pass alignment check.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Parse File type recorded in Ffs header.
#;           Adjust file offset for EFI_FV_FILETYPE_RAW, EFI_FV_FILETYPE_FREEFORM type file separately.
#;           Remove adding 4 byte pad action.
#; SolutionDependency: IB0730179 fix side effect of IB07300139 (Adopted in 05.03.02) and IB73000162 (Adopted in 05.03.14)

#; Tag#: 05.03.37
#; Issue#: IB08340141
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Recovery
#; Symptom: (ITS: 0028223) The SCU won't return default setting after Crisis Recover process with a signed binary.
#; RootCause: Recovery with a signed binary, system will skip whole NV region. Besides, there is no SmmVariable service to use under EMU variable.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Backup authenticated variables, let the flash utility to clear whole NV region. After crisis recovery,
#;           hook IHISI 16H(FbtsComplete) to force it to return to BIOS, and restore the authenticated variables afterwards.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB05670000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:

#; Category: EFI_DEBUG

#; Tag#: 05.03.36
#; Issue#: IB12360019
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: IHISI
#; Symptom: There is a new item "EC_DockWarning=messagestringA04" in Platform.ini of DOS flash tool v1.6k.
#;          When flash EC and using non-shared ROM, we may get a warning message - "GET EC part information fail."
#; RootCause: Flash tool will check IhisiStatus, IhisiLibErrorCodeHandler() always return IhisiFunNotSupported.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Change IhisiStatus default value to IhisiSuccess.
#;           2. Synchronize SharkBay and MahoBay Fets.c behavior, both use OemSvc to hook.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07390000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Added:
#;   1. MahoBayChipsetPkg\Library\SmmOemSvcChipsetLib\OemSvcIhisiS21HookFetsGetPartInfo.c

#; Tag#: 05.03.35
#; Issue#: IB02960561
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: Memory
#; Symptom: System will hang when Exit from Shell to SCU after ShellFlash AC detect fail in x64 environment.
#; RootCause:SmmVarBuffer pointer in Variable.c SmmInternalSetVariable function is used when returning from Shell to SCU. However, only lower 32bit value of SmmVarBuffer pointer is updated by GetDwordRegister. If the SmmVarBuffer has non-zero initial value in higher 32 bit data, it causes system hang when accessing unexpected 64bit SmmVarBuffer pointer address value.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Set default SmmVarBuffer pointer value to 0 in SmmInternalSetVariable function.
#;           2. Set default VariableBuffer pointer value to 0 in SmmDisableVariableCache function.
#;           3. Set default VariableBuffer pointer value to 0 in SmmLegacyBootEvent function.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB05670000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Variable\VariableRuntimeDxe\Variable.c
#;
#; Tag#: 05.03.35

#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: CSM
#; Symptom: BIOS send the write command to ROM during BDS phase.
#; RootCause: CSM16 erase PMM(Post memory manager) service before INT19, but the F Segment in lock state caused it has chances to be mapped to ROM on AMD chipset.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Change the erase $PMM structure process in F Segment unlock state.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB04580000

#; Tag#: 05.03.35
#; Issue#: IB02040342
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom: Sometime system hang on PXE image loading when plugged Realtek USB LAN in USB 3.0 port
#; RootCause: The periodic SMI/timer polling handler for non-SMI capable XHCI host controller wrongly clear the IOC event status and causing ExecuteTransfer function return EFI_TIMEOUT
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.01.35.0830
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.01.25.0622
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.01.25.0617
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.01.25.0617
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.01.35.0830
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.01.25.0619
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.01.25.0617
#; Solution: Adding busy flag in ExecuteTransfer routine to avoid periodic SMI/timer polling handler interrupt the critical section
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02040000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\Arm\XhciDxe.efi

#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\XhciDxe.inf

#; Tag#: 05.03.35
#; Issue#: IB02040341
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom: Sometime USB 3.0 device unable to be detected after system reset from OS on Intel BayTrail platform
