#; Tag#: 05.03.35
#; Issue#: IB02040340
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom: POST time increase ~100ms when system in AC mode on Intel BayTrail project board
#; RootCause: The OS ownership changed SMI bit be set due to set by OS ownership semaphore value clearing operation if it is set previously, and causing SMI triggered upon SMI on OS owner change handler being registered and waste time on event handling
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.01.35.0828
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.01.25.0622
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.01.25.0617
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.01.25.0617
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.01.35.0828
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.01.25.0619
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.01.25.0617
#; Solution: Write clear OS ownership changed SMI bit if it is set by OS ownership semaphore value clearing operation
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02040000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\Arm\XhciDxe.efi

#; Tag#: 05.03.34
#; Issue#: IB02960559
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: Variable
#; Symptom: (ITS:28007) Some platforms will BSOD while booting to Win 8.1 UEFI OS.
#; RootCause: OS may use attributes is 0 to call SetVariable function to delete variable at runtime, but we only trigger SMI to set variable if the attributes EFI_VARIABLE_NON_VOLATILE bit is set.
#;            In this situation, we may try delete nonvolatile variable in protected mode and variable region is locked by BIOS SMM region protection. It may caused unpredictable result on OS environment.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Change algorithm to trigger SMI to set variable after SMM code is ready and ready to boot event if variable attribute is 0.
#; SolutionDependency: IB02960559 fixes side effect of IB02960555 (Adopted in 05.03.33)
#; Reviewer: IB02700000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Variable\VariableRuntimeDxe\Variable.c
#;

#; Tag#: 05.03.33
#; Issue#: IB07240196
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: BDS
#; Symptom: Enable WTG (Windows To Go) start up options in UEFI Windows 8 and plug in IRONKEY USB device, which is Microsoft-Certified for WTG device, on board.
#;          At next boot, IRONKEY USB device is determined as a EFI USB device in Boot Manager. But it should belong to WTG device.
#; RootCause: BDS is too restrictive to check if Generic USB boot entry is WTG device or not.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Change the policy about how to determine WTG device. Following is the policy comparison between original and modified code:
#;           Old:(1) USB device
#;               (2) \EFI\BOOT\BOOT{machine type short-name}.EFI (for example, BOOTx64.EFI in x64 platform)
#;               (3) UEFI OS boot loader file (for example, \EFI\Microsoft\Boot\bootmgfw.efi for UEFI Windows OS)
#;           New:(1) USB device
#;               (2) \EFI\BOOT\BOOT{machine type short-name}.EFI which is signed file (for example, BOOTx64.EFI in x64 platform)
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02960000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Include\Library\GenericBdsLib.h
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Library\GenericBdsLib\BdsBoot.c
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Library\GenericUtilityLib\BootMngr\BootManager.c
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Library\SetupUtilityLib\Boot\BootMenu.c
#;   5. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\CommonPolicy\BootOptionPolicyDxe\BootOptionPolicy.c
#;

#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: Performance
#; Symptom: (Code Enhancement)
#; RootCause: (Code Enhancement)
#; Description: Some CPU spends much more time to access normal memory region if system is in SMM, so we do following change to reduce POST time.
#;              1. Don't send SMI to set volatile variable and just set volatile variable in protected mode.
#;              2. Check normal nonvolatile variable in protected mode and don't send SMI to set this variable if the variable data and attributes is identical with existed variable.

#; Issue#: IB02960554
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: Disk
#; Symptom:  (ITS:0027632) The system hangs during POST if its HDD includes invalid data in LBA1 and valid data in Last LBA and PcdRestoreGptTable PCD value is FALSE.
#; RootCause: PartitionDxe driver get data from primary partition table header no matter this header is valid or not. It may cause unexpected result, if we use this wrong data.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Correct the get valid partition table header algorithm.
#; SolutionDependency: IB02960554 fixed side effect of IB02960501 (Adopted in 05.02.51)

#; Tag#: 05.03.32
#; Issue#: IB04580742
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: PCI
#; Symptom: (ITS:0023247) [DOS,R2]The systme will hang at 80 port "26" when plug a PCIe x1 SCSI card.
#; RootCause: 1.The ModifyPirqTable function is called prior than PCI enumeration,
#;              it will make whole bus value for external device plugged in PCIe slot be patched to incorrect value(0)
#;              due to resource doesnt allocated yet.
#;            2.The PCIe root port swapping was introduced since Intel Cougar Pointer(HuronRiver/MahoBay),
#;              the PirqTable for legacy has no adjusted, it will caused Pirq table incorrect for remapped PCIe root port.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1.ModifyPirqTable() is called at first time GetRoutingTable() or TranslatePirq() functions called.
#;             This is sync to H2O 3.7 procedure.
#;           2.Remap the PCIe root port to desired position(PCI function number).
#;           3.Please do update the Legacy16.bin(version 1633).
#;           4.For details, please refer to P:\Engineering\Kernel\Issue Analysis\IrqRouting Issue\IRQ Routing Issues on SharkBay.pptx
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02960000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Csm\Legacy16\096\Legacy16.bin
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Csm\LegacyBiosDxe\LegacyBios.c
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Csm\LegacyBiosDxe\LegacyMp.c
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\CommonPolicy\LegacyBiosPlatformDxe\GetRoutingTable.c
#;   5. SharkBayChipsetPkg\PciPlatformDxe\PciPlatform.c
#;   6. SharkBayChipsetPkg\PciPlatformDxe\PciPlatformDxe.inf
#;
#; Tag#: 05.03.32
#; Issue#: IB08340128
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Security
#; Symptom: (ITS:0025704) The system won't trigger MSFT seamless recovery when power off during Firmware Update.
#; RootCause:
#;   1. The size of the file name "PcdPeiRecoveryFile" is not enough.
#;      System cannot find the correct recovery file.
#;   2. In seamless recovery, system will change the boot mode to BOOT_IN_RECOVERY_MODE, but SetupDataProvider doesn't change to the correct mode.
#;      It causes system cannot get the "Setup" variable data.
#;   3. With wrong "Setup" variable data, system cannot set the correct SATA mode information. EnableAhciController() is failed with the wrong SATA mode.
#;   4. AhciBusPei is not installed because EnableAhciController() is failed. So, the system doesn't search the recovery file from the hard disc.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution:
#;   1. Set enough size of the PCD "PcdPeiRecoveryFile".
#;   2. In SetupDataProvider, determine the correct bootmode according to seamless recovery process.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB05670000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Include\Library\SeamlessRecoveryLib.h
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Library\GenericBdsLib\RecoveryFlash.c

#;   7. SharkBayMultiBoardPkg\Project.dsc

#; Category: Common

#; Issue#: IB07880080
#; Severity: Fatal
#; Category: SATA
#; Symptom: When two AHCI controllers are both connected with SATA devices, system in AHCI mode will hang during S3 resuming.
#; RootCause: AhciBus driver only handles the data of one controller for S3 boot script restoration, and the data will be overwritten
#;            when handling the data of second controller.
#; Description: 1.(Bug Fix)
#;              2.(This version of Seamless SATA will be labeled as 02.01.31.0806.00)

#;                 AhciBusPei: 02.00.41.1016.00
#;                 IdeBusPei: 02.00.50.1218.00
#;                 AtaLegacySmm: 02.01.28.0716.00
#;                 StorageSecurityCommandDxe: 02.01.03.0122

#; Issue#: IB02040336
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: H2ODDT
#; Symptom: Unable to connect DDT when using USB3 debug port on BayTrail-M
#; RootCause: Two hardware fatal on BayTrail-M Dbc:
#;            1. Unable to transfer more than 0x40 bytes in single TD
#;            2. Unable to transfer data when the transmission buffer doesn't align on 0x20 memory boundary
#; Description: The version of H2ODebug is V3.7.7.24. Please using DebugConfig.exe to customize platform specific setting, and using latest version of H2ODDT for USB 3.0 support
#; Solution: 1. Split the TD into several TDs in single transmission
#;           2. Use internal aligned buffer for data transmission when the given buffer doesn't meet the request
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02040000

#; Issue#: IB02960547
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: Secure Boot
#; Symptom: (ITS: 0027310) Secure boot manual test will be failed. After finishing all of procedures in 04-LifetimeServicing folder and tries to boot msft_test_pressanykey.efi, it should succeed. But it will be failed.
#; RootCause: 1. The algorithm to check maximum chain length in Mocana library is incorrect. It will cause CERT_VerifyCertificatePoliciesAux () always returns failed if signed data has chained certificates.
#;            2. valCertFun () only check whole certificate is whether, but it doesn't check the leaf certificate from signed data is whether signed by current certificate. This may cause signed data with chained certificates will be verified failed.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Correct algorithm of check maximum chain length.
#;           2. Add code to do certificate validation check in valCertFun ().
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07990000

#; Issue#: IB09740033
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Console Redirection
#; Symptom: The Hyper terminal redirection screen was incorrect.
#;           1.Console Redirection default resolution will be 128 x 40 and it will not fit for Hyper terminal

#; Issue#: IB05670185
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Build
#; Symptom: 1. ChipsetPostBuild.bat is not called at the end of build process
#;          2. Build failed at the very beginning if Project package is not at the top level folder relative to Workspace folder.
#; RootCause: 1. CHIPSET_PKG is not defined while calling ProjectPostBuild.bat
#;            2. Relative path ".." is used, and incorrect folders are referenced if the project package is not at the top level folder relative to Workspace folder
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Add CHIPSET_PKG setting in ProjectPostBuild.bat before calling ChipsetPostBuild.bat
#;           2. Use %WORKSPACE% instead of relative path ".." in batch files
#; SolutionDependency: IB05670185 fixes the side effects of IB05670174,IB05670176 (Adopted in 05.03.24)

#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: SATA
#; Symptom: System can't detect Samsung PCIe SSD.
#; RootCause: The SSD has its own AHCI controller, but AhciBus driver can only handle devices connected to onboard SATA ports.

#;                 AhciBusDxe: 02.01.28.0716.00

#;                 AhciBusPei: 02.00.41.1016.00
#;                 IdeBusPei: 02.00.50.1218.00
#;                 AtaLegacySmm: 02.01.28.0716.00
#;                 StorageSecurityCommandDxe: 02.01.03.0122
#; Solution: Modify AhciBus and AtaLegacy driver to handle the kind of devices.

#; Issue#: IB07880074
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: SATA
#; Symptom: When platform has two AHCI controllers and both of them are connected with devices, AhciBus will retrieve wrong
#;          SMM private device data.
#; RootCause: AhciBus sets up all SMM controller data and then SMM device data. Thus, after setup of all SMM controller data is finished,
#;            pointer of controller will be fixed at the last controller. Error will occur when more than one AHCI controller is on platform.
#; Description: 1.(Bug Fix)
#;              2.(This version of Seamless SATA will be labeled as 02.01.26.0702.00)
#;                 AhciBusDxe: 02.01.26.0702.00
#;                 IdeBusDxe: 02.01.21.0528.00
#;                 AhciBusPei: 02.00.41.1016.00
#;                 IdeBusPei: 02.00.50.1218.00
#;                 AtaLegacySmm: 02.01.11.0319.00
#;                 StorageSecurityCommandDxe: 02.01.03.0122
#; Solution: Modify procedure of setting up SMM controller and device private data. After finishing SMM private controller data of each controller,
#;           AhciBus will start to set up SMM private data.
#; SolutionDependency: IB07880074 fixes side effect of IB07880059 (Adopted in 05.03.06)

#; Tag#: 05.03.26
#; Issue#: IB12360013
#; Severity: Tweak
#; Category: ACPI
#; Symptom: (Code Adjustment)
#; RootCause: (Code Adjustment)
#; Description: Hook AcpiS3Save->S3Save, let UpdateFacsHardwareSignature executed before S3Save function
#;              It can avoid LockBox save wrong Facs table's physical address.
#;              UpdateFacsHardwareSignature will update Facs table.
#;              Facs table's physical address may changed if have higher free memory space.
#;              So we hook S3Save function, let update Facs table executed first, and then LockBox saved address.
#; Solution: (Code Adjustment)
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB06720000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Acpi\AcpiPlatformDxe\AcpiPlatformDxe.inf
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Acpi\AcpiPlatformDxe\FacsUpdateCommon.c
#;

#; Issue#: IB02960542
#; Severity: Feature
#; Category: Crypto Service
#; Symptom: (New Feature)
#; RootCause: (New Feature)
#; Description: Some functions in Crypto Service always returns EFI_UNSUPPORTED. This update implement these unsupported functions:
#;              1. TDES related functions:
#;                 (1) TdesGetContextSize ()
#;                 (2) TdesInit ()
#;                 (3) TdesEcbEncrypt ()
#;                 (4) TdesEcbDecrypt ()
#;                 (5) TdesCbcEncrypt ()
#;                 (6) TdesCbcDecrypt ()
#;              2. AES related functions:
#;                 (1) AesCbcDecrypt ()
#;                 (2) AesCbcEncrypt ()
#;                 (3) AesEcbDecrypt ()
#;                 (4) AesEcbEncrypt ()
#;                 (5) AesGetContextSize ()
#;                 (6) AesInit ()
#;              3. DH related functions:
#;                 (1) DhNew ()
#;                 (2) DhFree ()
#;                 (3) DhGenerateParameter ()
#;                 (4) DhSetParameter ()
#;                 (5) DhGenerateKey ()
#;                 (6) DhComputeKey ()
#;              4. RSA related functions:
#;                 (1) RsaGetKey ()
#;                 (2) RsaSetKey ()
#;              5. Misc related functions:
#;                 (1) Pkcs7VerifyUsingPubKey ()
#;                 (2) RsaGetPrivateKeyFromPem ()
#;                 (3) RsaGetPublicKeyFromX509 ()
#;                 (4) X509GetSubjectName ()
#;                 (5) X509VerifyCert ()
#;                 (6) DhComputeKey ()
#; Solution: (New Feature)
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07990000

#; Tag#: 05.03.25
#; Issue#: IB02040334
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom: USB keyboard/mouse plugged in NEC D720101GJ USB 2.0 PCIe add-on card doesn't work under legacy OS(DOS)
#; RootCause: This device did implemented EHCI legacy support/control registers but not actually functional due to SMI pin doesn't connected to the board, it will caused whole interrupt events unable to be detected by EHCI driver and makes USB keyboard/mouse malfunction
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.01.25.0622
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.01.25.0622
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.01.25.0617
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.01.25.0617
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.01.25.0619
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.01.25.0619
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.01.25.0617
#; Solution: Implement the SMI testing routine in EHCI driver to detect the SMI capability to turn off the SMI related setting if SMI incapable on this device
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB010920000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\Arm\EhciDxe.efi
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\EhciDxe.inf
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\Ia32\EhciDxe.efi
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\X64\EhciDxe.efi
#;
#; Tag#: 05.03.25
#; Issue#: IB02040333
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom: (ITS:0026402) Kingston 2G dongle disappear after Win8 restart/S4 resume, and hang on POST logo if SCU Win8 fast boot disabled
#; RootCause:
#;   1. For the issue of unable to detected the dongle in Win8 after Win8 restart/S4 when CS enabled, this issue is caused by BIOS Connected Standby(Low Power S0 Idle Capability)switch. When CS is enabled, Win8 will send Stop Unit commands to USB mass storage upon restart/S4 suspend, it will make the Kingston dongle stopped and no longer active until hot-plug.
#;   2. For the issue of BIOS hang during POST after Win8 restart/S4 when CS enabled and Win8 fast boot disabled, this is caused by incorrect error handling on Inquiry command did not set the media BlockSize and caused divided by zero CPU exception
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.01.25.0621
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.01.25.0617
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.01.25.0617
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.01.25.0617
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.01.25.0619
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.01.25.0619
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.01.25.0617
#; Solution:
#;   1. For the issue of unable to detected the dongle in Win8 after Win8 restart/S4 when CS enabled, this is Win8 behavior and unable to be solved by BIOS
#;   2. For the issue of BIOS hang during POST after Win8 restart/S4 when CS enabled and Win8 fast boot disabled, correct the Inquiry error handling to setting related information to avoid divided by zero CPU exception
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02040000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbMassStorageDxe\UsbMassBoot.c
#;
#; Tag#: 05.03.25
#; Issue#: IB02040332
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom: eGalaxTouch EXC7910 USB touch panel doesn't work on SCU
#; RootCause: This device only allowed to transmit MaxPacketSize on interrupt transfer or it will unable to get the input data
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.01.25.0620
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.01.25.0617
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.01.25.0617
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.01.25.0617
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.01.25.0619
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.01.25.0619
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.01.25.0617
#; Solution: Change the transfer length to MaxPacketSize on interrupt transfer to fulfill the device requirement
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02040000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbTouchPanelDxe\UsbTouchPanel.c

#; Tag#: 05.03.25

#; Tag#: 05.03.24
#; Issue#: IB06720225
#; Severity: Feature
#; Category: PCI
#; Symptom: (New Feature)
#; RootCause: (New Feature)
#; Description:Implement IRQ routing feature following Rev5.0 customization style:
#;             Kernel driver get chipset IRQ routing information from ChipsetSvc.
#;             All these IRQ routing related settings are created by PCD in ChipsetPkg.
#;             1.gChipsetPkgTokenSpaceGuid.PcdDeviceXXInterruptRouteRegisterValue
#;             2.gChipsetPkgTokenSpaceGuid.PcdDeviceXXInterruptPinRegisterValue
#;               These two PCDs are Intel silicon related PCD, It will be retrieved and programmed on Chipset internal controller.
#;             3.gChipsetPkgTokenSpaceGuid.PcdPirqLinkValueArray
#;               This PCD provide an information about configuration register specified by PirqNumber.
#;             4.gChipsetPkgTokenSpaceGuid.PcdVirtualBusTable
#;               This PCD include all PCI bridge location under the bus 0 and virtual subordinary bus number of each bridge.
#;               This table help the engineer to understand the PCI topology in the build time,
#;               and use virtual subordinay bus to find out and set IRQ routing entry of the device under each bridge.
#;             5.gChipsetPkgTokenSpaceGuid.PcdControllerDeviceIrqRoutingEntry
#;               This PCD is a setting about chipset default IRQ routing entry list.
#;               This value can be customized by OEM to adjust routing table.
#;             6.Re-name BxPrt.asl to BxxPrt.asl for newer naming rule (i.e. xx is always two-digit)
#;             7.project ASL would mark where the PRT should go for each bus. A comment like this:
#;               // _PRT - BUS 0x00 - BEGIN - TOOL GENERATED. DO NOT MODIFY.
#;                 include "B00Prt.asl"
#;               // _PRT - BUS 0x00 - END - TOOL GENERATED. DO NOT MODIFY.
#; Solution: (New Feature)
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB10820000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Added:
#;   1. EmeraldLake2BoardPkg\AcpiTables\Dsdt\BusPRT\B00PRT.asl
#;   2. EmeraldLake2BoardPkg\AcpiTables\Dsdt\BusPRT\B02PRT.asl
#;   3. EmeraldLake2BoardPkg\AcpiTables\Dsdt\BusPRT\B03PRT.asl
#;   4. EmeraldLake2BoardPkg\AcpiTables\Dsdt\BusPRT\B04PRT.asl
#;   5. EmeraldLake2BoardPkg\AcpiTables\Dsdt\BusPRT\B05PRT.asl
#;   6. EmeraldLake2BoardPkg\AcpiTables\Dsdt\BusPRT\B06PRT.asl
#;   7. EmeraldLake2BoardPkg\AcpiTables\Dsdt\BusPRT\B07PRT.asl
#;   8. EmeraldLake2BoardPkg\AcpiTables\Dsdt\BusPRT\B08PRT.asl
#;   9. EmeraldLake2BoardPkg\AcpiTables\Dsdt\BusPRT\B09PRT.asl
#;   10.InsydeModulePkg\Include\IrqRoutingInformation.h
#;   11.InsydeModulePkg\Library\DxeChipsetSvcLib\DxeCsSvcIrqRoutingInformation.c
#;   12.MahoBayChipsetPkg\ChipsetSvcDxe\IrqRoutingInformation.c
#;   13.SharkBayChipsetPkg\ChipsetSvcDxe\IrqRoutingInformation.c
#;   14.SharkBayMultiBoardPkg\AcpiTablesDxe\Dsdt\BusPRT\B00PRT.asl
#;   15.SharkBayMultiBoardPkg\AcpiTablesDxe\Dsdt\BusPRT\B01PRT.asl
#;   16.SharkBayMultiBoardPkg\AcpiTablesDxe\Dsdt\BusPRT\B02PRT.asl
#;   17.SharkBayMultiBoardPkg\AcpiTablesDxe\Dsdt\BusPRT\B03PRT.asl
#;   18.SharkBayMultiBoardPkg\AcpiTablesDxe\Dsdt\BusPRT\B04PRT.asl
#;   19.SharkBayMultiBoardPkg\AcpiTablesDxe\Dsdt\BusPRT\B05PRT.asl
#;   20.SharkBayMultiBoardPkg\AcpiTablesDxe\Dsdt\BusPRT\B06PRT.asl

#; Tag#: 05.03.24
#; Issue#: IB12360012
#; Severity: Tweak
#; Category: Common
#; Symptom: (Code Adjustment)
#; RootCause: (Code Adjustment)
#; Description: Synchronize SharkBay and StrawBerryM SetSsidSvidDxe driver code behavior.
#;              SetSsidSvidDxe driver program device and save data to register, some region will be lock by PchInitBeforeBoot().
#;              PchinitBeforeBoot() use boot script to do Mem read/write, S3BootScriptEventCallBack() will change phase to runtime,
#; 			 after that, we can't use boot script.
#;              So we have to promise this order:
#;              1. SetSsidSvidCallBack()
#;              2. PchinitBeforeBoot()
#;              3. S3BootScriptEventCallBack()
#; Solution: (Code Adjustment)
#; SolutionDependency: IB12360012 synchronize with IB10130047(Adopted in 05.03.17)
#; Reviewer: IB06720000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. MahoBayChipsetPkg\CommonChipset\SetSsidSvidDxe\SetSsidSvidDxe.c
#;   2. MahoBayChipsetPkg\CommonChipset\SetSsidSvidDxe\SetSsidSvidDxe.inf
#;   3. SharkBayChipsetPkg\CommonChipset\SetSsidSvidDxe\SetSsidSvidDxe.c
#;   4. SharkBayMultiBoardPkg\BIOS\SHARKBAY.fd
#;   5. SharkBayMultiBoardPkg\BIOS\SHARKBAY_PFAT.fd
#;

#; Issue#: IB11420021
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: Graphics
#; Symptom: When switch-grahpics switches to discrete graphics, save & exit SCU
#;          possibly causes variable reclaim
#; RootCause: In PlugInVgaDisplaySelectionSave function, if SelectedAcpiADR

#; Tag#: 05.03.23
#; Issue#: IB07010137
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: HII
#; Symptom: (ITS26263) [POST,R1.5]The screen will show full black after Set Network IPv6 configuration: Manual and then return to Front Page.
#; RootCause: The Simple Font Package with unnecessary EFI_HII_PACKAGE_END will cause ExportPackageList export buffer value is smaller than the package length in one package.
#;            And then the device manager will access incorrect data, it maybe cause device manger go to dead loop.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Sync the HII package list header length with actual package length and remove unnecessary EFI_HII_PACKAGE_END.
#; SolutionDependency: IB07010137 fixes side effect of IB07010108 (Adopted in 05.02.47)
#; Reviewer: IB02960000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Library\GenericUtilityLib\DeviceMngr\DeviceManager.c
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\UserInterface\HiiDatabaseDxe\Database.c
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\UserInterface\UnicodeCollationDxe\UnicodeCollation.c

#; Tag#: 05.03.23
#; Issue#: IB07240187
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Boot
#; Symptom: (ITS:0026168) At first time boot, there is no physical boot device on system and boot to internal shell.
#;          At next boot, insert UEFI USB device on system and boot to UEFI USB device. Check boot order in Boot Manager.
#;          The boot priority of internal shell is higher than UEFI USB device and it doesn't follow "Add Boot Options" = "Auto" policy.
#; RootCause: When user doesn't press hot key, system doesn't sync physical boot order to BootOrder variable.
#;            It makes system restore incorrect BootOrder into physical boot order at next boot.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Sync physical boot order to BootOrder variable before boot device.
#; SolutionDependency: IB07240187 fixes side effect of IB02960521 (Adopted in 05.03.13)
#; Reviewer: IB02960000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Library\GenericBdsLib\BdsBoot.c

#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom: (ITS:0026140) Debug assert when boot to legacy mode through USB thumb drive if EFI_DEBUG enabled
#; RootCause: The SMM USB legacy driver using boot services under SMM with TPL_HIGH_LEVEL and causing debug assert in core code
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.01.22.0531. This is the side effect of IB02040319 at 05.03.10
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.01.21.0524
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.01.21.0524
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.01.22.0531

#; Issue#: IB07240182
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: SCU
#; Symptom: (ITS:0025978) When EFI_DEBUG enabled, system will show assert message when operating "PageUp" in SCU which have more items over one page.
#; RootCause: PageUp operation use wrong data (root link list) to do CR(). It trigger "CR has Bad Signature" assert.

#; Solution: Correct PageUp operation to prevent trigger "CR has Bad Signature" assert.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02960000

#; Category: Boot

#; Issue#: IB12740004
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Security
#; Symptom: EFI_RNG_PROTOCOL.GetRNG() cannot work properly.
#; RootCause: 1. The RNG has not been seeded before produces a RNG value.
#;            2. An incorrect return type EFI_STATUS used. It should be BOOLEAN.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Seeds the RNG using the EFI_CRYPTO_SERVICE_PROTOCOL.RandomSeed before produces a RNG value.

#; Issue#: IB02040327
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom: (ITS:0026070)USB 3.0 storage disappear when plugged both of USB storage and USB keyboard on Asmedia asm1042 USB3 chip and doing warm reset
#; RootCause: The link state of USB 3.0 port will becoming compliance mode a period after HCRESET upon system warm reset, and caused device enumeration missed
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.01.21.0524
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.01.21.0524
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.01.21.0524
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.01.11.0315
#; Solution:
#;   1. Fine tune the HCRESET code to waiting for link state recovered from compliance mode
#;   2. Fine tune the periodic timer related code to make the event polling callback can transfer from XHCI to EHCI
#; SolutionDependency: None

#; Issue#: IB05670164
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: OEM Services
#; Symptom: IHISI 1Eh function does not function correctly
#; RootCause: The EDK style Flash Map structure is obsolete on native EDKII

#; Issue#: IB02960534
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Recovery
#; Symptom: If user selects "No, boot to OS now" in recovery mode in BDS phase, it should boot to OS but it always restarts system.
#; RootCause: System uses EmuVariable in recovery mode and Memory consistency feature uses non-volatile variable to check memory consistency, so we should not check memory consistency in recovery mode.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Do not check memory consistency in recovery mode.
#; SolutionDependency: IB02960534 fixes side effect of IB02960526 (Adopted in 05.03.16)
#; Reviewer: IB07240000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Library\GenericBdsLib\MemoryCheck.c

#; Category: BDS
#; Symptom: "Reset System" option is not workable in Boot Maintenance Manager

#; Issue#: IB11420019
#; Severity: Feature
#; Category: Graphics
#; Symptom: (New Feature)
#; RootCause: (New Feature)
#; Description: This OEM Service is called under legacy/dual boot mode after Vbios loaded and before Video Child
#;              Handle installed. This function is used when some specific events happens, allows OEM to set
#;              the preferred boot display device. For Instance, when there's lid-close event occurring, OEM
#;              could detect current display devices attached and then set the preferred boot display device.
#;              The information of this OEM Service, please refer to P:\Engineering\Kernel\Core\H2O 5.0\"InsydeH2O 50 OEM Kernel Services Technical Reference 101 27Mar2013Draft.doc"
#; Solution: (New Feature)
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB05670000
#; RelatedFiles:

#;   1. OemServicesPkg\Library\DxeOemSvcKernelLib\OemSvcChangeVbiosBootDisplay.c

#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom: (ITS:0025664)USB boot failed when it is connected behind Buffalo USB 3.0 HUB and set SCU xHCI Pre-boot Driver Enabled on Sharkbay ULT platform.
#; RootCause: Not enough timeout after HUB port reset due to Buffalo USB 3.0 HUB needs up to 2 seconds to waiting to port reset completed
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.01.19.0506
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208

#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.01.17.0426
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.01.11.0315

#; Tag#: 05.03.17
#; Issue#: IB08340110
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: Security
#; Symptom: (ITS: 0023048) System hangs when hot plugging a USB device during flash process.
#; RootCause: The TPL level of Secure Flash Event is TPL_NOTIFY. Before LoadImage()/StartImage(), the TPL is changed to TPL_CALLBACK and then clear variables.
#;            Some events still need to get variable. When a USB device hot plugs during flash process, these events are triggered.
#;            And incorrect variable data are used in these events.
#; Description: (Code Enhancement)
#; Solution: Before LoadImage()/StartImage(), modify the TPL to EFI_TPL_APPLICATION and not to clear variables.
#;           Please also adopt IB08340100 to modify the behavior of BiosProtectDxe and SecureFlashDxe.
#; SolutionDependency: IB08340110 enhances IB08340100 (Adopted in 05.03.12)
#; Reviewer: IB05670000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Security\SecureFlash\SecureFlashDxe\SecureFlashDxe.c
#;
#; Tag#: 05.03.17
#; Issue#: IB11420015
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: Graphics
#; Symptom: connect two identical monitors to internel Gop, Logo doesn't show native resolution on efi mode
#; RootCause: when combination of two video output devices attached to the Gop device, 1024 * 768 always being set
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: find optimal resolution from Gop modes to set for combination of two video output devices
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB10030000

#; Severity: Fatal
#; Category: Network
#; Symptom: In some project, System will hang when user canceled UEFI PXE IPv6.

#; Issue#: IB02040322
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom: Unable to complete SCT 2.3.1 BootableimageSupportTest test items when USB key plug in USB 3.0 port
#; RootCause: The XHCI port reset executed by SCT will reconnect USB related protocols and caused SCT unable to continue the rest of test items
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.01.17.0426
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.01.17.0426
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.01.06.0208
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.01.11.0315
#; Solution:
#;   1. Ignore the root port enumeration upon port connection changed SMI generated by XHCI port reset to prohibit unnecessary USB related protocol re-installation
#;   2. Change the TPL of USB hot plug timer callback from TPL_NOTIFY to TPL_CALLBACK to preventing the reentrancy of USB hot plug timer callback. Please also adopt IB08520077 to solve the USB hot plug doesn't work upon inputting HDD password issue
#; SolutionDependency: IB08520077
#; Reviewer: IB10620000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\Arm\XhciDxe.efi
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\Ia32\XhciDxe.efi

#; Issue#: IB05670160
#; Severity: Feature
#; Category: Build
#; Symptom: (New Feature)
#; RootCause: (New Feature)
#; Description: Add "YES" and "NO" to be allowed to be used in Feature PCD value in DSC
#;              (1) Update build.exe and GenFds.exe to support YES/NO assignment to feature PCD in DSC (but not in DEC)
#;              (2) Use switches defined in Project.env for feature PCD settings
#;              (3) Remove multiple feature PCD definitions in Package.dsc under InsydeModulePkg and Chipset package folders.

#; Issue#: IB02960526
#; Severity: Feature
#; Category: S4 Resume
#; Symptom: (New Feature)
#; RootCause: (New Feature)
#; Description: Automatically adjust runtime and boot services types pre-allocated memory size to prevent from S4 resume failed if pre-allocated memory size is too small.
#;              Following is the behavior change in this update (if MEMORY_MAP_CONSISTENCY_CHECK switch is YES):
#;              Original: It will show detail message on screen, if the pre-allocated runtime types memory size is too small.
#;              Updated:  System will adjust runtime and boot services types memory size if the pre-allocated runtime or boot services memory size is tool small.
#; Solution: (New Feature)

#; Tag#: 05.03.15
#; Issue#: IB07240180
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: RTC
#; Symptom: In SharkBay ULT platform, remove CMOS battery and set date to 2030/8/8 in Windows 8. SCU time will show 2048/8/8 at next boot.
#; RootCause: Remove CMOS battery makes the bit 2 of CMOS register B set to 1 (i.e. time/date data are binary format), but OS always assume that time and date are BCD format.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. System always set time/date in BCD format every boot.
#;           2. Add check for wakeup time. If wakeup time is invalid, system will set to default time.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02960000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Isa\PcRtcRuntimeDxe\PcRtc.c

#; Category: Recovery

#; Issue#: IB07880064
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: SATA
#; Symptom: (ITS:0024264) AHCI driver spends too much time during POST on SharkBay ULT platform.
#; RootCause: If receiving FIS is enabled before signature checking, it can't be disabled after signature checking on this platform.
#; Description: 1.(Bug Fix)
#;              2.(This version of Seamless SATA will be labeled as 02.01.13.0402.00)
#;                 AhciBusDxe: 02.01.13.0402.00
#;                 IdeBusDxe: 02.01.10.0312.00
#;                 AhciBusPei: 02.00.41.1016.00
#;                 IdeBusPei: 02.00.50.1218.00
#;                 AtaLegacySmm: 02.01.11.0319.00
#;                 StorageSecurityCommandDxe: 02.01.03.0122
#; Solution: Enabling receiving FIS before signature checking is for compatibility with specific HDD.
#;           Thus, to enable and disable receiving FIS is bypassed on this platform when checking signature.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB08520000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\AhciBusDxe\AhciBusDxe.inf

#; Tag#: 05.03.13
#; Issue#: IB02960525
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Secure Boot
#; Symptom: Using customer's test key to sign secure flash capsule and customer's public is saved in db variable in secure boot enabled environment, system will show "LoadImage () Failed!" error message.
#; RootCause: MergeVariableToFactoryCopy () checks data from last byte of factory copy data. If the first byte isn't 0xFF, it indicates this byte is last variable offset. But if the last valid byte data in factory copy data is 0xFF, this algorithm is incorrect.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Correct get last variable offset algorithm in MergeVariableToFactoryCopy ().
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07240000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Library\VariableSupportLib\SecureBootSupport.c
#;
#; Tag#: 05.03.13
#; Issue#: IB02960524
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Secure Boot
#; Symptom: WHCK build 9347 secure boot manual test failed. The Failed item is test case 1A. The "** 1 ** pressanykey1.efi" prompt should be displayed, but it boot failed.
#; RootCause: WHCK build 9347 uses page hashes to sign pressanykey.efi. In this situation, the SpcIndirectDataContent size in Authenticode signature is large than 0x80 and DER will use multiple bytes instead of
#;            single byte to save length. But we always consider the length of SpcIndirectDataContent is encoded by 1 byte.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Correct the algorithm to calculate header size of SpcIndirectDataContent.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07240000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Library\BaseCryptLib\Pk\CryptPkcs7.c
#;

#; Issue#: IB10620021
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom: (ITS: 0024791) UDF format USB key can not boot on kernel 3.7 code base platform.
#; RootCause: The ReadCapacity command to the MSFT USB key returns wrong LastBlock after executing the Read(10) command,
#;            causes the following Read(10) commands failure.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: In UsbBootDetectMedia (), only invokes the ReadCapacity command when the TestUnitReady command returns MEDIA_CHANGED.
#;           The MEDIA_CHANGED status only shows in the case of changeable media(like CD-ROM), not in the case of USB key.
#; SolutionDependency: None

#; Tag#: 05.03.12
#; Issue#: IB12360001
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Audio
#; Symptom: Verb table installation is not success and it will cause audio and mic are not workable.
#; RootCause: When use some combo card, system maybe needs the delay during the state changing from RESET to INIT because
#;            each codec has different latency to come out from RESET.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Create a new OEM service named as "OemGetWaitTimerAfterHdaInit()" and OEM could customize different delay
#;           time to make sure each codec could come out from RESET. When OEM return 0 second, system just init HDA bus
#;           and polling the state from RESET. If NOT, system will init HDA bus first and then delay. After delay is done,
#;           system will init HDA bus again and polling the state from RESET. The delay time is project dependent.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB10620000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Added:
#;   1. EmeraldLake2BoardPkg\Library\PeiOemSvcKernelLib\OemSvcGetWaitTimerAfterHdaInit.c
#;   2. OemServicesPkg\Library\PeiOemSvcKernelLib\OemSvcGetWaitTimerAfterHdaInit.c
#;   3. StrawberryMountainBoardPkg\Library\PeiOemSvcKernelLib\OemSvcGetWaitTimerAfterHdaInit.c
#;   4. SharkBayMultiBoardPkg\Library\PeiOemSvcKernelLib\OemSvcGetWaitTimerAfterHdaInit.c
#; Modified:
#;   1. EmeraldLake2BoardPkg\Library\PeiOemSvcKernelLib\PeiOemSvcKernelLib.inf
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\InsydeModulePkg.dec
#;   3. MahoBayChipsetPkg\CommonChipset\InstallVerbTablePei\InstallVerbTablePei.c
#;   4. MahoBayChipsetPkg\CommonChipset\InstallVerbTablePei\InstallVerbTablePei.h
#;   5. MahoBayChipsetPkg\CommonChipset\InstallVerbTablePei\InstallVerbTablePei.inf
#;   6. OemServicesPkg\Include\Library\PeiOemSvcKernelLib.h
#;   7. OemServicesPkg\Library\PeiOemSvcKernelLib\PeiOemSvcKernelLib.inf
#;   8. OemServicesPkg\Library\PeiOemSvcKernelLib\PeiOemSvcKernelLibDefault.inf

#; Tag#: 05.03.12
#; Issue#: IB06720210
#; Severity: Feature
#; Category: SMBIOS
#; Symptom: (New Feature)
#; RootCause: (New Feature)
#; Description: 1. SmbiosMemory driver doesn't support LPDDR3 DRAM Device Type.
#;                 Add SPD_LPDDR3_SDRAM type in Ddr3SpdRegs.h and log LPDDR3 DRAM device as DDR3 on SMBIOS type17.
#;              2. OEM hasn't an interface to customize SPD data to the on-board RAM.
#;                 Remove CUSTOMER_SPD macro from OemSmbiosMemory.h and
#;                 Create an OemSvcEx (OemSpdDataAndSlotStatus ()) for OEM to provide runtime SPD data and slot status.
#;              3. SmbiosMemory driver doesn't support runtime update customized SPD data to the on-board RAM and runtime hidden slot information on different SKU.
#;                 Let SmbiosMemory driver get SPD data from gOemSpdDataGuid HOB for on-board RAM, and get SlotStatus from gSlotStatusGuid HOB.
#;                 These two HOBs are runtime created by different SKU.
#;                 If gOemSpdDataGuid HOB does not be created, SPD overwrite won't be triggered (i.e. SPD data is read from SMBus).
#;                 If gSlotStatusGuid HOB does not be created, all four slots information are present in SMBIOS.
#;                 Since the SPD overwrite feature will be triggered dependent on HOB is created or not,
#;                 original USE_CUSTOMER_SPD_DATA switch and channel slots map macro for SPD overwrite has been removed.
#;              4. Implement an PeiOemServicesExThunk PEIM for ECP OemSvcEx.
#;              5. Remove Chipset.h from ChispetPkg/Include and use ECP chipset.h for PeiOemServicesExThunk and SmmOemServicesExThunk.
#; Solution: (New Feature)
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB03090000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Added:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Include\Guid\OemSpdDataGuid.h
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Include\Guid\SlotStatusGuid.h
#;   3. MahoBayChipsetPkg\Include\Library\PeiOemSvcChipsetLib.h
#;   4. MahoBayChipsetPkg\Library\PeiOemSvcChipsetLib\
#;   5. MahoBayChipsetPkg\Library\PeiOemSvcChipsetLib\OemSpdDataAndSlotStatus.c

#;   10. MahoBayRefCodePkg\SystemAgent\MemoryInit\Pei\MRC_OemPlatform.h
#;   11. MahoBayRefCodePkg\SystemAgent\MemoryInit\Pei\MRC_Types.h
#;   12. MahoBayRefCodePkg\SystemAgent\MemoryInit\Pei\Source\
#;   13. MahoBayRefCodePkg\SystemAgent\MemoryInit\Pei\Source\Api\

#; Tag#: 05.03.11
#; Issue#: IB10920018
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: ACPI
#; Symptom: "EFI_DEBUG = YES" + S3 sleep test will cause platform reset.
#; RootCause: The boot script executor uses Debug function on S3 resume, the function uses PEI and DXE phase Debug Library Class,
#;            but DebugLib in DXE phase include "Boot Services", it will cause platform reset on S3 resume.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: BootScriptExecutorDxe (MdeModulePkg) and BootScriptSaveOnS3SaveStateThunk (EdkCompatibilityPkg) modules need to use DebugLibNull for DebugLib class
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB05670000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. EdkCompatibilityPkg\Package.dsc
#;   2. MdeModulePkg\Package.dsc
#;
#; Tag#: 05.03.11
#; Issue#: IB05670147
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: Variable
#; Symptom: Setup variable cannot be correctly retrieved in PEI after memory is initialized
#; RootCause: The Setup variable cache mechanism fails after memory initialized because CAR(Cache As Ram) memory is not valid after memory initialized
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Remove Setup variable data cache mechanism in SetupDataProvider module
#; SolutionDependency: IB05670147 fixes the side effect of IB05670132
#; Reviewer: IB07300000

#; Tag#: 05.03.11
#; Issue#: IB07240175
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: BDS
#; Symptom:
#;   Set "Boot Type" to "Legacy Boot Type" and set "Add Boot Options" to "First".
#;   When plug in the second identical USB/HDD device, system will boot to first device. It should boot to second device by "Add Boot Options" policy.
#; RootCause: The BBS table data will be the same for two identical USB/HDD devices. It makes BDS confuse to distinguish devices.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution:
#;   Add the memory address of device path in BBS table and add device path data in optional data region of legacy device boot variable.
#;   It makes BDS can distinguish two identical device by comparing device path data.
#; SolutionDependency: IB07240175 need related mechanism provided by IB02040319 (Adopted in 05.03.10), IB04580716 (Adopted in 05.03.11),
#;                     IB07880063 (Adopted in 05.03.11), IB10620020 (Adopted in 05.03.10)
#; Reviewer: IB02960000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Library\GenericBdsLib\BdsBoot.c
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Library\GenericBdsLib\BdsMisc.c
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Library\GenericUtilityLib\BootMaint\BBSsupport.c
#;

#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: SetupMouse
#; Symptom: Sometimes user use mouse or touch to click in virtual KB, the Graphics SCU will scroll the screen.

#; Tag#: 05.03.10
#; Issue#: IB12360002
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Security
#; Symptom: BIOS can be flashed when enable secure flash.
#; RootCause: Protected Range Register is locked before programming.
#;            This issue is caused by B_PCH_SPI_HSFS_FLOCKDN is set prior to BiosProtectEvent function.
#;            B_PCH_SPI_HSFS_FLOCKDN is set by PchInitBeforeBoot function.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Change TPL from -1 to +1 cause BiosProtectEvent is dispatched before PchInitBeforeBoot.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB06720000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\CommonPlatform\BiosProtectDxe\BiosProtectDxe.c

#; Issue#: IB02960516
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: RTC
#; Symptom: fwts UefirtTime test failed. The error message is "Failed to get wakeup time with UEFI runtime service".
#; RootCause: In runtime services GetWakeupTime (), it will check output time is whether valid. But if wakeup time isn't enabled,
#;            This function will not initialize time zone and daylight for output time. In this situation, the output time is invalid and
#;            this function will return EFI_DEVICE_ERROR.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: No matter wakeup time is enabled or disabled, GetWakeupTime () always initializes time zone and daylight.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07240000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\PcRtcRuntimeDxe\PcRtc.c
#;
#; Tag#: 05.03.09
#; Issue#: IB02960515
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: BDS
#; Symptom: (ITS:0024141) Installing ubuntu OS in secure boot enabled environment, Boot Manager will show two ubuntu boot options (ubuntun and Ubuntu).
#; RootCause: For secure boot enabled environment, ubuntu OS will create secure boot enabled file path "EFI\ubuntu\shimx64.efi" instead of normal file
#;            path "EFI\ubuntu\grubx64.efi". During next POST, BIOS will create boot option for normal file path "EFI\ubuntu\grubx64.efi", so it will show
#;            two boot options in boot manager.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Add mechanism to check secure boot enabled file path first, and only check normal file path if secure boot enabled file path not found.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07240000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Include\Library\GenericBdsLib.h
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Library\GenericBdsLib\BdsBoot.c
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Library\GenericBdsLib\BdsMisc.c
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Library\GenericBdsLib\InternalBdsLib.h

#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom:
#;   Unable to detected the Sony DRX-S90U ODD during POST when cold boot
#; RootCause:
#;   The connection signal from data cable will be postponed around 500~700ms after the power cable get initialed, it will causing BIOS unable to create the ODD into boot menu in BDS driver because the ODD be detected after boot menu establishment. This is device special behavior

#; Issue#: IB07990093
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Network
#; Symptom: (Update EDKII Solutions)
#; RootCause: (Update EDKII Solutions)
#; Description: (rev.13995) 1. Add EFI_COMPONENT_NAME2_PROTOCOL.GetControllerName() support.
#;              (rev.13995) 2. Fix the driver binding Stop() hang issue in the network stack.
#;              (rev.13995) 3. Add Ip4 raw data support.
#;              (rev.13995) 4. Add iSCSI Dhcp option 60 support.
#;              (rev.14007) 1. Fix GCC build fail issue for MdeModulePkg and NetworkPkg.
#;              (rev.14017) 1. Fix buffer overflow bugs in SNP, MNP and IP6 driver.
#;              (rev.14017) 2. Fix GCC build fail issue in DxeNetLib.
#;              (rev.14039) 1. Client must ignore any Advertise message that includes a Status Code option containing the value NoAddrsAvail.
#;              (rev.14039) 2. The elapsed-time should start from the current DHCP transaction.
#;              (rev.14039) 3. Client should not change any information about addresses the client has recorded in the IA but not included in the IA from the server.
#;              (rev.14039) 4. Client need to update to handle the error status code UnspecFail/UseMulticast/NotOnLink/NoBinding in the Reply message from server.
#;              (rev.14039) 5. When the client receives a Reply message in response to a Renew/ Rebind message, the client examines each IA independently. For each IA in the original Renew/ Rebind message, the client sends a Renew/ Rebind if the IA is not in the Reply message.
#;              (rev.14039) 6. Client should uses network byte order in IANA T1/T2 option
#;              (rev.14039) 7. Client should discard any addresses for which the preferred lifetime is greater than the valid lifetime.
#;              (rev.14115) 1. Fix a bug in SNP driver binding Start() that it may return incorrect status code.
#;              (rev.14116) 1. Fix corrupt PXE boot menu display issue.
#; Solution: (Update EDKII Solutions)
#; Reviewer: IB07240000
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Network\ArpDxe\Arm\ArpDxe.efi

#; Tag#: 05.03.06
#; Issue#: IB07990091
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: Network
#; Symptom: UEFI IPv6 PXE cannot work when first boot after firmware flashed.
#; RootCause: The DHCP6 Client ID has been updated after PXE started.
#;            Lead to the DHCP6 received and ignored different Client ID packet, but DHCP6 is correct and needed receive and process.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Update the Client ID when PXE and DHCP start.
#;           2. In IP6 and DHCP6, the Random function use gRT->GetTime, but the Time.Nanosecond is always zero.
#;              Lead to UEFI PXE is failed at PXE start when DHCP6 and IP6 driver dispatch at the same second.
#;              To fix this case, The DHCP6 IAID will update when DHCP6 start.
#; Reviewer: IB07240000
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Network\Dhcp6Dxe\Arm\Dhcp6Dxe.efi
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Network\Dhcp6Dxe\Ia32\Dhcp6Dxe.efi
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Network\Dhcp6Dxe\X64\Dhcp6Dxe.efi
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Network\UefiPxeBcDxe\Arm\UefiPxeBcDxe.efi
#;   5. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Network\UefiPxeBcDxe\Ia32\UefiPxeBcDxe.efi
#;   6. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Network\UefiPxeBcDxe\X64\UefiPxeBcDxe.efi
#;
#; Tag#: 05.03.06
#; Issue#: IB02040314
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom:
#;   POST time increase 250~500ms on Intel SharkBay platform when USB enabled
#; RootCause:
#;   The Intel RMH on SharkBay doesn't recognized by USB HUB initial code and go through normal HUB path with 250ms stall to waiting for HUB port power on
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.01.06.0206
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.01.01.0103
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.00.39.0928
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.01.01.0103
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.01.01.0103
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.01.02.0109
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.00.45.1109
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.01.01.0103
#; Solution:
#;   Added wildcard setting in HUB lookup table to bypass the 250ms delay on whole Intel RMH
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB10620000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbBusDxe\Hub.c

#; Issue#: IB07880058
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: SATA
#; Symptom: The system can't boot from the security-enabled HDD when the timing of unlocking HDD is postponed
#;          in AHCI mode with UEFI boot type.
#; RootCause: The policy of bypassing subsequent commands to read LBA0 does not consider the condition that HDD is locked.
#;            If HDD is locked, the following commands to read LBA0 should not be bypassed.
#; Description: 1.(Bug Fix)
#;              2.(This version of Seamless SATA will be labeled as 02.01.05.0205.00)
#;                 AhciBusDxe: 02.01.05.0205.00
#;                 IdeBusDxe: 02.00.50.1218.00
#;                 AhciBusPei: 02.00.41.1016.00
#;                 IdeBusPei: 02.00.50.1218.00
#;                 AtaLegacySmm: 02.00.50.1218.00
#;                 StorageSecurityCommandDxe: 02.01.03.0122
#; Solution: Enhance the checking policy for the condition that HDD is locked.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB08520000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\AhciBusDxe\AhciBusDxe.inf

#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\AhciBusDxe\X64\AhciBusDxe.efi
#;
#; Tag#: 05.03.05
#; Issue#: IB07240171
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: RTC
#; Symptom: (ITS:0023829) Discharge CMOS by leaving the battery out of the system before power-on. System time will show 10013/1/1 in Windows OS on some platforms.
#; RootCause: Bit 7 of CMOS century register will be set after discharging CMOS on some platforms and it will not be cleared during POST.
#;            It makes Windows OS miscalculate the year value by reading CMOS century register.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Clear bit 7 of CMOS century register during POST.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02960000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\PcRtcRuntimeDxe\PcRtc.c
#;
#; Tag#: 05.03.05
#; Issue#: IB07240170
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: BDS
#; Symptom: (ITS:0023897) If add more memory on system at next boot, it will show memory map inconsistency message on screen before boot device.
#; RootCause: FPDT(Firmware Performance Data Table) driver will allocates memory for S3 performance table and saves the memory address in non-volatile variable at first boot.
#;            At next boot, it will allocate memory at the same address which is gotten from non-volatile variable.
#;            It makes memory map check function detect that an allocated runtime memory is not in the system pre-alloacted region if add more memory on system at next boot.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: For S3 performance table of FPDT driver, add a skip memory range in memory map consistency check function.
#; SolutionDependency: IB07240170 fixed side effect of IB07240156 (Adopted in 05.03.01)
#; Reviewer: IB02960000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Library\GenericBdsLib\BdsBoot.c
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Library\GenericBdsLib\GenericBdsLib.inf
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Library\GenericBdsLib\InternalBdsLib.h
#;

#; Symptom: (ITS:0023380) Using RAID1 to install UEFI OS and then change mode to AHCI mode. After using AHCI mode to enter SCU and then change mode return to RAID mode, system cannot boot to OS.

#; Issue#: IB02960504
#; Severity: Feature
#; Category: System Password
#; Symptom: (New Feature)
#; RootCause: (New Feature)
#; Description: Add PcdSecureSysPasswordSupported PCD. This PCD is only workable when PcdSysPasswordInCmos PCD is FALSE.
#;              1. If PcdSysPasswordInCmos is TRUE, system password is saved in CMOS.
#;              2. If PcdSysPasswordInCmos is FALSE and PcdSecureSysPasswordSupported is FALSE, system uses normal variable to save supervisor password.
#;              3. If PcdSysPasswordInCmos is FALSE and PcdSecureSysPasswordSupported is TRUE, system uses Insyde secure variable to save supervisor password.
#;              The default setting of PcdSecureSysPasswordSupported switch is FALSE.
#; Solution:(New Feature)
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07240000

#; Tag#: 05.03.01
#; Issue#: IB02040309
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom:
#;   System hang on POST code 0x1b or 0x21 when plugged Dell HL-DT-STDVD+-RW GP60N ODD in USB 3.0 port
#; RootCause:
#;   Not enough Read10 timeout and caused Usb babble error upon Read10 command
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.01.01.0104
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.01.01.0103
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.00.39.0928
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.01.01.0103
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.01.01.0103
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.01.01.0103
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.00.45.1109
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.01.01.0103
#; Solution:

#; Tag#: 05.03.01
#; Issue#: IB02040308
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom:
#;   The UsbLegacyPlatform protocol malfunction to change the Usb policy on Intel SharkBay code base
#; RootCause:
#;   The UsbLegacyPlatform protocol installed after Usb driver launched and caused Usb driver unable to get the Usb policy
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.01.01.0103
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.01.01.0103
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.00.39.0928
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.01.01.0103
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.01.01.0103
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.01.01.0103
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.00.45.1109
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.01.01.0103
#; Solution:
#;   Registers the UsbLegacyPlatform protocol notification to make the Usb driver can get the Usb policy properly
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB10620000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\Arm\EhciDxe.efi
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\EhciDxe.inf

#; Issue#: IB02040305
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom:
#;   System hang when plugged USB 3.0 device in Intel SharkBay USB 3.0 port with XHCI set to enabled/smart-auto in SCU
#; RootCause:
#;   Memory overflow due to not enough memory buffer for root port hub which more than 16 downstream ports
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.00.51.1217
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.00.49.1203
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.00.39.0928
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.00.49.1203
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.00.49.1203
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.00.49.1203
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.00.45.1109
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.00.49.1203
#; Solution:
#;   Enlarge internal memory buffer from 16 to 32 elements to accommodate more than 16 downstream ports
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB10620000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbBusDxe\UsbBus.h

#; Issue#: IB02960501
#; Severity: Feature
#; Category: Disk
#; Symptom: (New Feature)
#; RootCause: (New Feature)
#; Description: Add PcdRestoreGptTable to control partition driver to determine restore GPT table policy.
#;              If this PCD is TURE, system will restore correct GPT table if one of primary GPT table or backup
#;              GPT table is invalid. and then install handle for partition if at least one GPT table is valid.
#;              If this PCD is FALSE, system only check GPT table is valid. If at lease one GPT table is valid,
#;              system will install handle for this partition.
#;              This default PCD value is FALSE.
#; Solution: (New Feature)
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07240000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\InsydeModulePkg.dec

#; Tag#: 05.02.50
#; Issue#: IB07880056
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: SCT
#; Symptom: [SCT test] The title of failed description is "UEFI-Compliant-Globally Defined Variable check"
#;          and the error message is "Illegal Variable: PcdPortNumberMapTable."
#; RootCause: AhciBusDxe and IdeBusDxe drivers set variable by gEfiGlobalVariableGuid to save PcdPortNumberMapTable address.
#;            According to UEFI spec. 2.3.1, to prevent name collisions with possible future globally defined variables, other
#;            internal firmware data variables that are not defined in "3.2 Globally Defined Variables" must be saved with a
#;            unique VendorGuid other than EFI_GLOBAL_VARIABLE.
#; Description: 1.(Bug Fix)
#;              2.(This version of Seamless SATA will be labeled as 02.00.50.1218.00)
#;                 AhciBusDxe: 02.00.50.1218.00
#;                 IdeBusDxe: 02.00.50.1218.00
#;                 AhciBusPei: 02.00.41.1016.00
#;                 IdeBusPei: 02.00.50.1218.00
#;                 AtaLegacySmm: 02.00.50.1218.00
#;                 StorageSecurityCommandDxe: 02.00.21.0530
#; Solution: Set variable by gEfiGenericVariableGuid instead.
#; SolutionDependency: IB07880056 fixes side effect of IB07880051 (Adopted in 05.02.44)
#; Reviewer: IB08520000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\AhciBusDxe\AhciBusDxe.inf
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\AhciBusDxe\Ia32\AhciBusDxe.efi
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\AhciBusDxe\X64\AhciBusDxe.efi
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\IdeBusDxe\Ia32\IdeBusDxe.efi
#;   5. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\IdeBusDxe\IdeBusDxe.inf
#;   6. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\IdeBusDxe\X64\IdeBusDxe.efi

#; Symptom: Without connecting any SATA device to platform, IdeBusPei driver spends long time during crisis recovery
#;          procedure in IDE mode.
#; RootCause: IdeBusPei driver does not filter out the invalid status of port register before checking status of port
#;            register.
#; Description: 1.(Code enhancement)
#;              2.(This version of Seamless SATA will be labeled as 02.00.50.1218.00)
#;                 AhciBusDxe: 02.00.48.1204.00
#;                 IdeBusDxe: 02.00.48.1204.00
#;                 AhciBusPei: 02.00.41.1016.00
#;                 IdeBusPei: 02.00.50.1218.00
#;                 AtaLegacySmm: 02.00.44.1113.00
#;                 StorageSecurityCommandDxe: 02.00.21.0530
#; Solution: IdeBusPei driver aborts procedure and returns error status when the status of port register is invalid.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB08520000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\IdeBusPei\Ia32\IdeBusPei.efi
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\IdeBusPei\IdeBusPei.inf
#;
#; Tag#: 05.02.50
#; Issue#: IB08340086
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: Security
#; Symptom: (ITS:0023048) Error occurs when user plugs an USB device in the period of flashing firmware in the Secure Flash process.
#; RootCause: In boot process, Secure Flash creates an event "SecureFlashReadyToBootEvent" for updating a flag "mInPOST".
#;            This flag is used for disabling IHISI write function at Runtime.
#;            The event "SecureFlashReadyToBootEvent" is triggered when user hot plugs an USB device in the period of flashing firmware.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Only create the event "SecureFlashReadyToBootEvent" in normal boot process.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB05670000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Security\SecureFlash\SecureFlashDxe\SecureFlashDxe.c
#;
#; Tag#: 05.02.50
#; Issue#: IB07240159
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Boot
#; Symptom: Set "Add Boot Options" to First and set USB Entry for Windows To Go boot option to second boot priority.
#;          If user re-startup Windows To Go boot option in Win 8, system will restore it to second boot priority at next boot.
#; RootCause: If BootOrder variable contains dummy boot option, BDS will directly restore BootOrder variable from
#;            backup boot order to keep the priority of physical boot devices.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Keep the original boot order to sync the priority of physical boot devices into BootOrder variable.
#; SolutionDependency: IB07240159 fixed side effect of IB07240120 (Adopted in 03.72.24)
#; Reviewer: IB02960000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Include\Library\GenericBdsLib.h
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Library\GenericBdsLib\BdsBoot.c
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Library\GenericBdsLib\BdsMisc.c
#;

#; Category: HDD Password
#; Symptom: After Win8 restart, USB input can't be used when HDD dialog is displaying.

#; Tag#: 05.02.49
#; Issue#: IB02040303
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom:
#;   Shell command "reconnect -r" caused system hang under dual boot mode
#; RootCause:
#;   USB code reference to invalid memory due to some memory resource doesn't released/updated by USB HC binding start/stop function
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.00.49.1203
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.00.49.1203
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.00.39.0928
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.00.49.1203
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.00.49.1203
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.00.49.1203
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.00.45.1109
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.00.49.1203
#; Solution:
#;   Free/update the related memory resource on USB HC binding start/stop function to keep the memory resource get updated
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB10620000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:

#; Category: EFI Debug
#; Symptom: EFI debug always asserts error in MemoryInitPei.c after executing GetPlatformMemorySize PPI.
#; RootCause: Currently GetPlatformMemorySize function just provides the default memory map information. But this function always returns EFI_NOT_FOUND because it can not find EfiMemoryTypeInformation variable which is created by BdsLibSaveMemoryTypeInformation function.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Currently the EfiMemoryTypeInformation variable is not used to adjusting memory map, so return EFI_SUCCESS in GetPlatformMemorySize function, unless this function builds EfiMemoryTypeInformation HOB with error status.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB03090000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\CommonPlatform\PlatformStage1Pei\Memory.c
#;

#; Tag#: 05.02.46
#; Issue#: IB07880052
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: SCT
#; Symptom: If changing to RAID mode and Dual boot type, SCT test has failed item in BlockIOProtocolTest.
#; RootCause: SCT sends a read command, which attempts to read LBA 0 with zero buffer size. SCT expects "EFI_SUCCESS" but
#;            the result is "EFI_INVALID_PARAMETER."
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Upgrading the priority of checking if buffer size is zero to meet SCT requirement.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB08520000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Csm\BiosThunk\BlockIoDxe\BiosBlkIo.c
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Csm\BiosThunk\BlockIoDxe\BiosBlkIo.h
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Csm\BiosThunk\BlockIoDxe\BiosInt13.c
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Csm\BiosThunk\BlockIoDxe\BlockIoDxe.inf
#;   5. InsydeModulePkg\Csm\BiosThunk\BlockIoDxe\Edd.h
#;
#; Tag#: 05.02.46
#; Issue#: IB02040301
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom:
#;   (ITS:0022560) System reboot repeatedly when insert "Team Fusion 4GB" USB thumb drive in USB port
#; RootCause:
#;   The empty string reported by UFI Inquiry command and caused string operation failure
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.00.46.1113
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.00.43.1026
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.00.39.0928
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.00.41.1012
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.00.11.0316
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.00.45.1109
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.00.45.1109
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.00.33.0817
#; Solution:
#;   Given "Generic USB storage" for nameless USB device to be the device identifier
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB010620000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbMassStorageDxe\UsbMassBoot.c
#;
#; Tag#: 05.02.46
#; Issue#: IB02040300
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom:
#;   Sometime USB 3.0 mass storage unable to be detected on Asmedia asm1042 USB3 chip
#; RootCause:
#;   The USB 3.0 device will disappear a short period after host controller reset and make the port been ignored
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.00.45.1109
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.00.43.1026
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.00.39.0928
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.00.41.1012
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.00.11.0316
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.00.45.1109
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.00.45.1109
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.00.33.0817
#; Solution:
#;   Added a port presence testing procedure to waiting for USB 3.0 device show up after host controller reset
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB010620000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\Arm\XhciDxe.efi
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\Ia32\XhciDxe.efi
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\X64\XhciDxe.efi

#;   7. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciPei\XhciPei.inf
#;   8. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbCoreDxe\Legacy.c
#;
#; Tag#: 05.02.46
#; Issue#: IB05670112
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: Recovery
#; Symptom: Crisis Recovery failed if OEM crisis protection table existed with SECURE_FASH_SUPPORT = YES
#; RootCause: The incorrect BIOS image size was given in the input parameter of FlashBIOS() function.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Modify FirmwareAuthentication PEI module
#;           2. Update PeiCrisis PEIM to get BIOS image offset and size from recovery capsule file before calling FlashBIOS()
#;           3. Update PeiFat and CdExpress PEIM to report Bios Image size in the recovery Hob
#;           4. Update EmuPeiGate driver to report Bios image size in the recovery Hob

#; Issue#: IB07880050
#; Severity: Fatal
#; Category: SATA
#; Symptom: System hangs on SMM exception handler when POST to logo without any boot device plugged in the platform.
#; RootCause: AtaLegacySmm driver registers a notification on SMM AtaPassThruProtocol prior to driver been unloaded
#;            due to no SATA device available, it will caused the SMM AtaPassThurProtocol notify to unavailable callback
#;            function and caused CPU exception in SMM.
#; Description: 1.(Bug Fix)
#;              2.(This version of Seamless SATA will be labeled as 02.00.43.1030.00)
#;                 AhciBusDxe: 02.00.43.1030.00
#;                 IdeBusDxe: 02.00.43.1030.00
#;                 AhciBusPei: 02.00.41.1016.00
#;                 IdeBusPei: 02.00.38.0925.00
#;                 AtaLegacySmm: 02.00.43.1030.00
#;                 StorageSecurityCommandDxe: 02.00.21.0530
#; Solution: AtaLegacySmm driver registers a notification on SMM AtaPassThruProtocol only when AtaLegacyEntry is successfully
#;           finished.
#; SolutionDependency: IB07880050 fix side effect of IB07880046 (Adopted in 05.02.38)
#; Reviewer: IB08520000

#;
#; Tag#: 05.02.43
#; Issue#: IB02040298
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom:
#;   1. (ITS:0022150) Sometime the enter key will auto repeatedly under UEFI Shell when USB keyboard plugged behind USB 2.0 HUB
#;   2. (ITS:0022073) Sometime system unable to detected the Lenovo PRIMAX-KB4721 USB keyboard when press ESC key repeatedly during POST on Intel platform
#;   3. Unable to get response when using N-Trig touch panel with finger
#; RootCause:
#;   1. The checking procedure of interrupt in bulk transfer wrongly clear the internal data and caused key release interrupt malfunction
#;   2. The Intel RMH will disconnect the Lenovo PRIMAX-KB4721 USB keyboard during HUB port reset if press ESC key repeatedly
#;   3. The finger touch report ID did not recorded correctly due to report descriptor parsing failure by incorrect data type
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.00.43.1026
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.00.43.1026
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.00.39.0928
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.00.41.1012
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.00.11.0316
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.00.41.1012
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.00.39.0928
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.00.33.0817
#; Solution:
#;   1. Correct checking procedure of interrupt to keep the internal data
#;   2. Retry the HUB port reset to reconnect the USB keyboard to workaround this hardware fatal
#;   3. Modify the report descriptor parsing procedure to make data type update correctly
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB05670000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\EhciDxe.inf
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\Ia32\EhciDxe.efi
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\X64\EhciDxe.efi
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbBusDxe\UsbBus.c
#;   5. InsydeModulePkg\Library\HidDescriptorLib\HidDescriptorLib.c
#;

#; Issue#: IB02960491
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Secure Boot
#; Symptom: Setting "Restore Secure Boot to Factory Settings" option to Enabled in Secure Boot Option menu and then press F10 to save settings. If user powers off
#;          during next boot, sometimes Win8 OS cannot show "Use a Device" menu. In some projects, it will cause cannot entry hibernate.
#; RootCause: Backup factory copy to spare region missing last 8 bytes, so the last 8 bytes of factory copy data will be missing if restoring factory copy from spare.
#;            In this situation, GetNextVariableName () cannot get variables which are after this incorrect variable.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Backup correct factory copy data to spare region.
#;           2. Check NameSize member in variable header and real variable name size in GetNextVariableName ().
#;           3. Delete variable if NameSize member in variable header and real variable name size aren't the same while doing reclaim.
#; SolutionDependency: None

#; RelatedFiles:

#; Issue#: IB07880048
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: SATA
#; Symptom: SPFDISK fails to read HDD partitions.
#; RootCause: AtaPassThru protocol is installed to EFI_SMM_RUNTIME_PROTOCOL and AtaLegacySmm

#; Description: 1.(Bug Fix)
#;              2.(This version of Seamless SATA will be labeled as 02.00.41.1016.00)
#;                 AhciBusDxe: 02.00.41.1016.00
#;                 IdeBusDxe: 02.00.41.1016.00
#;                 AhciBusPei: 02.00.41.1016.00
#;                 IdeBusPei: 02.00.38.0925.00
#;                 AtaLegacySmm: 02.00.41.1016.00
#;                 StorageSecurityCommandDxe: 02.00.21.0530
#; Solution: AtaPassThru protocol is installed to EFI_SMM_SYSTEM_TABLE2 additionally,
#;           and AtaLegacySmm locates AtaPassThru protocol from EFI_SMM_SYSTEM_TABLE2.

#; Tag#: 05.02.41
#; Issue#: IB02040297
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom:
#;   1. OS hang after disconnect OHCI driver in UEFI Shell
#;   2. (Redundancy code adjustment in XHCI DXE driver)
#; RootCause:
#;   1. The OHCI binding stop procedure did not clear HC ownership correctly and caused OS failed on OHCI HC ownership change
#;   2. (Redundancy code adjustment in XHCI DXE driver)
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.00.41.1012
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.00.39.0928
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.00.39.0928
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.00.41.1012
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.00.11.0316
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.00.41.1012
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.00.39.0928
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.00.33.0817
#; Solution:

#; Tag#: 05.02.41
#; Issue#: IB07880047
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Recovery
#; Symptom: When connecting SATA ODD to port 0 and HDD with recovery file to port 1, crisis recovery in AHCI mode fails.
#; RootCause: In AHCI recovery procedure, BIOS will first detect ATA device and then detect ATAPI device. In the loop of detecting
#;            devices connected at each port, BIOS will exit when finding connected device but the device type is not the one
#;            procedure is currently searching for.
#; Description: 1.(Bug Fix)
#;              2.(This version of Seamless SATA will be labeled as 02.00.41.1016.00)
#;                 AhciBusDxe: 02.00.40.1002.00
#;                 IdeBusDxe: 02.00.38.0925.00
#;                 AhciBusPei: 02.00.41.1016.00
#;                 IdeBusPei: 02.00.38.0925.00
#;                 AtaLegacySmm: 02.00.38.0925.00
#;                 StorageSecurityCommandDxe: 02.00.21.0530
#; Solution: Continue detecting loop until all ports have been detected even when the found device type is not the one procedure is
#;           currently searching for.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB08520000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\AhciBusPei\AhciBusPei.inf
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\AhciBusPei\Ia32\AhciBusPei.efi
#;

#; Tag#: 05.02.38
#; Issue#: IB02040296
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom:
#;   1. Poor transmission performance on EHC/XHC when USB device behind HUB
#;   2. 500ms POST time increase on Intel CloverTrail platform
#;   3. (ITS:0021520) Buffalo USB 3.0 flash drive plugged in USB 2.0 port unable to be detected and cause other USB device not work on Intel ChiefRiver platform
#;   4. Unable to get response when using N-Trig touch panel
#; RootCause:
#;   1. Unnecessary short packet interrupt SMI slow down the transmission speed
#;   2. EHC spending 500ms on root port power on stall due to Intel CloverTrail supporting port power switch
#;   3. Intel ChiefRiver platform will generate babble error when hub port reset and caused device stop to re-enumeration
#;   4. Sometime N-Trig touch panel will generate data length less than desire length and caused whole packet be skipped, this should be device firmware issue
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.00.39.0928
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.00.39.0928
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.00.39.0928
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.00.15.0413
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.00.11.0316
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.00.39.0928
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.00.39.0928
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.00.33.0817
#; Solution:
#;   1. Block the short packet interrupt SMI during data transfer
#;   2. Skip the root port power on stall if the port is powered on already during HC initialization
#;   3. Implement babble error recovery code to workaround this hardware fatal
#;   4. Ignore the length checking when actual length less than desire length
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB05670000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\EhciDxe.inf
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\Ia32\EhciDxe.efi
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\X64\EhciDxe.efi
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciPei\EhciPei.inf
#;   5. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciPei\Ia32\EhciPei.efi
#;   6. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\Ia32\XhciDxe.efi
#;   7. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\X64\XhciDxe.efi
#;   8. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\XhciDxe.inf
#;   9. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciPei\Ia32\XhciPei.efi
#;   10. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciPei\XhciPei.inf
#;   11. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbBusDxe\UsbBus.c
#;   12. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbBusDxe\UsbHelper.c
#;   13. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbTouchPanelDxe\UsbTouchPanel.c
#;
