#; Issue#: IB02960476
#; Severity: Feature
#; Category: Secure Boot
#; Symptom: (New Feature)
#; RootCause: (New Feature)
#; Description: 1. According to PI specification version 1.2.1 to implement EFI_SECURITY2_ARCH_PROTOCOL.
#;              2. EFI_SECURITY_ARCH_PROTOCOL only verifies EFI image if system uses EFI device path to load image. But it will not verify EFI image, if
#;                 system uses memory buffer to load image. This is a security hole, so add EFI_SECURITY2_ARCH_PROTOCOL to increase security.
#; Solution: (New Feature)
#; SolutionDependency: None

#; Tag#: 05.02.37
#; Issue#: IB02960478
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Variable
#; Symptom: (ITS: 0021465) If setting EFI_DEBUG = YES in Config.template and doing long run test, sometime system will assert in variable driver during POST. The failed rate is about 1/300.
#; RootCause: Reclaim function doesn't clear whole variable cache to 0xFF before synchronizing the data between variable store and variable cache, so it only
#;            copies valid data from variable store to variable cache and the unused data space between variable cache and variable store aren't the same.
#;            (All of unused data in variable store is 0xFF, but all of unused data in variable cache is garbage.)
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Clearing whole variable cache to 0xFF before synchronizing variable cache and variable data in Reclaim function.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07240000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Variable\VariableRuntimeDxe\Variable.c
#;
#; Tag#: 05.02.37
#; Issue#: IB02960477
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: Disk
#; Symptom: (ITS:00021470) In OEM project and system is in RAID/IRST mode, system will boot failed after doing recovery.
#; RootCause: Recovery utility creates a GPT table which AlternateLBA in primary GPT header is greater than last LBA in block IO protocol, so partition driver cannot
#;            read backup GPT header from AlternateLBA. In this situation, this GPT table will be considered an invalid GPT table and partition driver will not install
#;            block IO protocol for these partitions which defined in this GPT table.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Partition driver also installs block IO protocol for partitions which defined in a GPT table if primary GPT header is valid and backup GPT header is invalid in this table.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB072400000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Disk\PartitionDxe\Gpt.c
#;
#;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#; Label#: 05.02.36
#; Status: Build tip : ~/StrawberryMountain   Test platform : StrawberryMountain DDR3
#;         1.Uefi64 and Uefi64ddt Compile successfully
#;         2.Uefi64 Boot to DOS successful
#;         3.Uefi64 Install Windows Windows8 RTM with no error

#; Issue#: IB07240137
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: BDS
#; Symptom: (ITS: 0020893) The system won't check memory when set "Quick Boot" to disabled in SCU.
#; RootCause: System allocates too much memory which exceed the preserve size.
#;            It triggers all EfiGcdMemoryTypeReserved type memory promote to EfiGcdMemoryTypeSystemMemory type.
#;            It makes there is no memory need to be tested in BDS.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: If all memory promote to EfiGcdMemoryTypeSystemMemory type before BDS and "Quick Boot" is disabled,
#;           show memory test information on screen when BDS perform memory test.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02960000

#; Category: SMBIOS

#; Issue#: IB02040292
#; Severity: Tweak
#; Category: HID
#; Symptom: (New Feature)
#; RootCause: (New Feature)
#; Description: Code adjustment for supporting PAD and LED related capabilities
#; Solution: (New Feature)
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07010000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Smbus\I2cKbDxe\Efikey.c
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Include\Library\HidDescriptorLib.h
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Library\HidDescriptorLib\HidDescriptorLib.c
#;
#; Tag#: 05.02.35
#; Issue#: IB02040291
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom:
#;   1. Unable to UEFI boot to NAND flash on Pericom EHCI host controller
#;   2. Unable to recognize USB FDD plugged in USB 2.0 port when PEI crisis recovery
#;   3. System hang during POST when some USB HID device plugged in USB port
#; RootCause:
#;   1. The EECP value invalid and caused HC be stopped
#;   2. The EHCI Framelist wrongly link to null QH
#;   3. The length of HID descriptor too large to fit in preallocated memory and caused memory overflow. This is side effect of IB02040284 item 2
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.00.35.0831
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.00.35.0831
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.00.35.0831
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.00.15.0413
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.00.11.0316
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.00.33.0817
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.00.34.0824
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.00.33.0817
#; Solution:
#;   1. Following EHCI spec to check EECP value to set no legacy support
#;   2. Make the CreatePeriodicDummyQH prior to CreateFrameList to make correct sequence
#;   3. Increase the preallocated memory from 0x10 to 0x100 to accommodate large size of HID descriptor
#; SolutionDependency: IB02040291 item 3 fixed the side effect of IB02040284 item 2
#; Reviewer: IB05670000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\EhciDxe.inf
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\Ia32\EhciDxe.efi
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\X64\EhciDxe.efi
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciPei\Ia32\EhciPei.efi
#;   5. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbBusDxe\UsbBus.h
#;
#; Tag#: 05.02.35

#;   188. UefiCpuPkg\Universal\Acpi\S3Resume2Pei\S3Resume.c
#;   189. UefiCpuPkg\Universal\Acpi\S3Resume2Pei\S3Resume2Pei.inf
#;
#; Tag#: 05.02.34
#; Issue#: IB07240133
#; Severity: Fatal
#; Category: Hii, SCU
#; Symptom: 1. There are some items show "!" when set Language to <Francais> and <___>.
#;          2. In SCU, the select item icon "_" and select menu icon "_" is not correct.
#;          3. Code adjustment
#; RootCause: 1. EFI_HII_STRING_PROTOCOL.GetString() only search the string for specified language.
#;            2. Find glyph mechanism will return the first found glyph for both narrow and wide glyph.
#;               It makes "_" always be found in wide glyph.
#;            3. Code adjustment
#; Description: 1. (Bug Fix)
#;              2. (Bug Fix)
#;              3. Move HiiDatabaseDxe, SetupBrowserDxe, SetupMouseDxe UnicodeCollationDxe and language drivers of Fonts in InsydeModulePkg/UserInterface folder.
#; Solution: 1. Enhance the search mechanism of EFI_HII_STRING_PROTOCOL.GetString(). It will find the string for other languages if specified language is not found.
#;           2. Enhance find glyph mechanism which user can define narrow or wide glyph of the string in UNI file.
#;           3. Code adjustment
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02960000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Added:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Library\UefiHiiLib\
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Library\UefiHiiLib\HiiLanguage.c
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Library\UefiHiiLib\HiiLib.c
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Library\UefiHiiLib\HiiString.c

#; Category: Recovery
#; Symptom:  1. System will encounter failure when attempting to read secure flash binary file from SATA ODD.
#;           2. AhciPei.c/AhciPei.h/AhciPei.inf naming is not identical to follow EDKII convention.
#; RootCause: 1. Secure flash binary file is 16MB, and read command will encounter failure when trying to read all file
#;               by one time.
#;            2. AhciPei.c/AhciPei.h/AhciPei.inf should be renamed to AhciBusPei.c/AhciBusPei.h/AchiBusPei.inf
#;               to follow EDKII convention.
#; Description: 1. (Bug Fix)
#;              2. (Code Enhancement)
#;              3. (This version of Seamless SATA will be labeled as 02.00.33.0822.00)
#;                  AHCI PEI: 02.00.33.0822.00
#;                  StorageSecurityCommandDxe: 02.00.21.0530
#; Solution: 1. Limit read size to 0x400 for each ATAPI read command.
#;           2. Rename AhciPei.c/AhciPei.h/AhciPei.inf to AhciBusPei.c/AhciBusPei.h/AchiBusPei.inf
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB05670000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Added:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Include\Ppi\AhciController.h
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\AhciBusPei\AhciBusPei.inf
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\AhciBusPei\Ia32\AhciBusPei.efi
#; Deleted:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\AhciBusPei\AhciPei.inf
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\AhciBusPei\Ia32\AhciPei.efi
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\AhciBusPei\AhciBusPei.inf
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\AhciBusPei\Ia32\AhciBusPei.efi
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Package.dsc
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Package.fdf
#;
#; Tag#: 05.02.33

#; Category: Build, SCU

#; Tag#: 05.02.33
#; Issue#: IB02960470
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Variable
#; Symptom: 1. In system which supports OS switchable feature and after flash BIOS done. system cannot enter S4 if user operates system as below:
#;             Windows(Boot First)-->Android(S3 Boot) -->Windows(S3 Resume) -->Windows hybrid shutdown or normal S4 or S5-->Android(S3 Resume)
#;             -->Windows(S3 Boot) -->Windows hybrid shutdown or Normal S4. System couldn_t enter S4 mode.
#;          2. Using variable edit tool sometimes cannot delete NV+BS attribute variable in legacy WinPE environment.
#; RootCause: 1. OS switchable feature saves non-volatile variable cache data in exit boot services event. But UEFI OS will
#;               set variable in runtime and it will cause real data in non-volatile variable cache and saved by OS switchable feature
#;               aren't the same.
#;            2. System uses EfiRuntimeServicesData memory to save some information for SMM mode, but EfiRuntimeServicesData may be used by legacy OS after legacy boot event.
#; Description: 1. (Bug Fix)
#;              2. (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Save the start address and length of non-volatile variable cache in system table for OS switchable feature.
#;           2. Restore these information from EfiRuntimeServicesData memory to SMM RAM in legacy boot event.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07240000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Variable\VariableRuntimeDxe\SecureBoot.c
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Variable\VariableRuntimeDxe\Variable.c
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Variable\VariableRuntimeDxe\Variable.h
#;

#; Tag#: 05.02.33
#; Issue#: IB02040286
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom:
#;   1. System hang on POST when NEC USB FDD plugged in Renesas USB 3.0 port
#;   2. System hang on legacy boot upon unplugged USB device with EFI_DEBUG turned on
#; RootCause:
#;   1. Renesas USB 3.0 HC unable to received control status data on NEC FDD when the TRB beyond LINK TRB
#;   2. The working TPL higher than the required TPL for FAT driver lock/unlock and then get into assert routine
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.00.33.0817
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.00.29.0720
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.00.29.0720
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.00.15.0413
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.00.11.0316
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.00.33.0817
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.00.33.0817
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.00.33.0817
#; Solution:
#;   1. To insert a NOP at first TRB to workaround this issue
#;   2. Lower the working TPL to meet the TPL requirement in FAT driver
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\Ia32\EhciDxe.efi
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\X64\EhciDxe.efi
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\OhciDxe\Ia32\OhciDxe.efi
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\OhciDxe\X64\OhciDxe.efi
#;   5. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\UhciDxe\Ia32\UhciDxe.efi
#;   6. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\UhciDxe\X64\UhciDxe.efi
#;   7. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\Ia32\XhciDxe.efi
#;   8. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\X64\XhciDxe.efi
#;   9. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\XhciDxe.inf
#;   10. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciPei\Ia32\XhciPei.efi
#;   11. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciPei\XhciPei.inf
#;   12. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbBusDxe\UsbBus.c
#;   13. InsydeModulePkg\Csm\UsbLegacySmm\Ia32\UsbLegacySmm.efi

#; Tag#: 05.02.31
#; Issue#: IB02040284
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom:
#;   1. (ITS:0020766) Unable to detected device on some USB multi flash card reader
#;   2. Unable to detected some USB keyboard when USB touch panel driver get built
#;   3. Devicom USB LAN unable to work
#;   4. Sometime warm reset hang when WD my book essential plugged in USB 2.0 port
#;   5. USB keyboard malfunction after hot plug during HDD password prompt
#;   6. (New Feature) Produce UEFI DiskInfo protocol for USB mass storage to compliant with PI 1.2 spec
#;   7. (New Feature) Use EDKII libraries instead of assembly procedures in UsbCoreDxe to reduce CPU dependency
#; RootCause:
#;   1. The UsbLegacy driver did not set appropriate LUN under for read command and caused media detecting error
#;   2. Some USB keyboard will failed on getting interface descriptor with interface number large than zero. This is USB keyboard firmware issue
#;   3. The alternate setting in the interface descriptor did not changed after set interface request to different alternate setting
#;   4. The WD my book will reset the configuration value after change the USB interface from USB 3.0 to 2.0 and caused subsequently BOT transfer failed. This is device firmware issue
#;   5. USB hot plug connection procedure be blocked due to the CALLBACK TPL used by USB hot plug connection procedure is equal to the TPL level of HDD password prompt procedure
#;   6. (New Feature) Produce UEFI DiskInfo protocol for USB mass storage to compliant with PI 1.2 spec
#;   7. (New Feature) Use EDKII libraries instead of assembly procedures in UsbCoreDxe to reduce CPU dependency
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.00.31.0803
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.00.29.0720
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.00.29.0720
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.00.15.0413
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.00.11.0316
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.00.29.0720
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.00.23.0608
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.00.31.0803
#; Solution:
#;   1. Set appropriate LUN under in UsbLegacy driver
#;   2. Get interface descriptor from device descriptor instead of issuing GetHidDescriptor control transfer to workaround firmware issue
#;   3. Add alternate setting support to let class driver can change to appropriate interface
#;   4. Set configuration again when BOT transfer failed to workaround firmware issue
#;   5. Change the TPL from CALLBACK to NOTIFY to make the USB hot plug procedure can work on HDD password prompt
#;   6. (New Feature) Produce UEFI DiskInfo protocol for USB mass storage to compliant with PI 1.2 spec
#;   7. (New Feature) Use EDKII libraries instead of assembly procedures in UsbCoreDxe to reduce CPU dependency
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Deleted:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbCoreDxe\AsmUtil.h
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbCoreDxe\IA32\
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbCoreDxe\X64\
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\EhciDxe.inf
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\Ia32\EhciDxe.efi
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\X64\EhciDxe.efi
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciPei\Ia32\EhciPei.efi
#;   5. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\OhciDxe\Ia32\OhciDxe.efi
#;   6. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\OhciDxe\OhciDxe.inf
#;   7. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\OhciDxe\X64\OhciDxe.efi
#;   8. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\OhciPei\Ia32\OhciPei.efi
#;   9. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\UhciDxe\Ia32\UhciDxe.efi

#; Tag#: 05.02.31
#; Issue#: IB07240122
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: Shell
#; Symptom: The system will show " '(' is not recognized as an internal or external command...." after boot to UEFI Shell.
#; RootCause: Optional data of BIOS created option variable is RC signature which is passed to load option of image information.
#;            Shell will process load option and the behavior will depend on the memory address of load option.
#; Description: (ITS:0020574)
#; Solution: For BIOS created option variable, don't copy optional data to load option of image information.
#; SolutionDependency: IB07240122 fixed side effect of IB02960351 (Adopted in 03.70.45)
#; Reviewer: IB02960000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:

#; Symptom: (ITS:0020261) On UEFI mode, [Del] & [Delete] Keys can't detect by new MonitorKey driver.
#; RootCause: The monitorKey driver will register incorrect key data, it will cause hot key can't be detected.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Set correct key data, when hot key is registered.

#; Tag#: 05.02.29
#; Issue#: IB02040281
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom:
#;   1. (ITS:0020576) ChiefRiver USB 3.0 port hot plug malfunction under POST/DOS when XHCI set to Enabled
#;   2. (ITS:0020648) To do cold boot long run under DOS, the system will show "Disk I/O error" on AMD Virgo platform
#;   3. System stall around 10 seconds when some multi-LUN device hot plug under UEFI Shell
#;   4. Mouse cursor will be keep on top-left upon finger leave the touch screen on some multi-touch panel
#;   5. The wrong key code generated by USB keyboard upon Ctrl-Alt-Del pressed when ResetSystem been ignored in purposely
#; RootCause:
#;   1. The ChiefRiver XHCI BEI(Blocking Event Interrupt) caused the port change event be blocked. This could be hardware issue and unable to fixed by software. This is the side effect of IB02040250 item 1
#;   2. Two operations refer to the hardware TotalBytes value in EHCI TD and caused fake error result due to length calculation error
#;   3. The installation procedure in binding start wrongly stopped by empty LUN and cause binding stop procedure spend time on reconnection
#;   4. The dummy packet be treated as data due to some touch panel unable to set to idle mode and keep providing dummy packet to host
#;   5. The procedure after ResetSystem been processed and caused wrong code key be generated
#; Description: This version of Seamless USB is labeled as 02.00.29.0720
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.00.29.0720
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.00.29.0720
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.00.15.0413
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.00.11.0316
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.00.29.0720
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.00.23.0608
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.00.28.0713
#; Solution:
#;   1. To avoid to use BEI, use of SMI on IOC switch instead to blocking interrupt during bulk transmission, also correct some mass storage procedure for WD my book USB3 HDD
#;   2. To reserve the TotalBytes into local variable for use of length operations
#;   3. Correct the installation procedure in binding start to keep enumerating rest of LUN
#;   4. To refer the contact count value(if supported) in the packet to identify the data content is dummy or not
#;   5. Quit immediately after ResetSystem return to caller to preventing wrong action be executed
#; SolutionDependency: The item 1 fixed the side effect by IB02040250 item 1
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\EhciDxe.inf
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\Ia32\EhciDxe.efi
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\X64\EhciDxe.efi
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciPei\EhciPei.inf
#;   5. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciPei\Ia32\EhciPei.efi
#;   6. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\Ia32\XhciDxe.efi
#;   7. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\X64\XhciDxe.efi
#;   8. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\XhciDxe.inf
#;   9. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbBotDxe\UsbMassBot.c
#;   10. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbKbDxe\Keyboard.c
#;   11. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbMassStorageDxe\UsbMassBoot.c
#;   12. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbMassStorageDxe\UsbMassImpl.c
#;   13. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbTouchPanelDxe\UsbTouchPanel.c
#;   14. InsydeModulePkg\Include\Library\HidDescriptorLib.h
#;   15. InsydeModulePkg\Library\HidDescriptorLib\HidDescriptorLib.c

#; Tag#: 05.02.28
#; Issue#: IB02960461
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: Variable
#; Symptom: Item 1-3 are new variable relative issues in SCT 2.3.1 2012 summer summit version
#;          1. EFI Compliant Test failed. SetupMode variable attribute is incorrect.
#;          2. Set invalid normal time base authenticated variable, system should return EFI_SECURITY_VIOLATION, but it returns EFI_NOT_FOUND.
#;          3. Set valid normal time base authenticated variable, system should return EFI_SUCCESS, but it returns EFI_NOT_FOUND.
#;          4. (New Feature)
#;          5. In some OEM projects and secure boot enabled environment, user sets secure boot enforce to disabled but the secure boot is still enabled.
#; RootCause: 1. SetupMode, SecureBoot, and SignatureSupport variable attribute are incorrect. The Attribute should be EFI_VARIABLE_BOOTSERVICE_ACCESS | EFI_VARIABLE_RUNTIME_ACCESS.
#;            2-3. System doesn't have code to handle normal time base authenticated variable, so it always return EFI_NOT_FOUND if KEK variable doesn't exist.
#;            4. (New Feature)
#;            5. System doesn't synchronize SecureBootEnforce and SecureBoot variable immediately.
#; Description: 1-3.(Bug Fix)
#;              4. According to EFI SPEC 2.3.1 Errata C, Support four new globally varaibles "PKDefault", "KEKDefault", "dbDefault", and dbxDefault.
#;              5. (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Correct the attribute of SetupMode, SecureBoot, and SignatureSupport variables.
#;           2-3. Implement normal time based authenticated variable feature.
#;           4. (New Feature)
#;           5. Set SecureBoot variable to 0 immediately if setting SecureBootEnforce variable to 0.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB04270000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Include\Library\BaseCryptLib.h
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Include\Library\VariableSupportLib.h
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Include\Protocol\CryptoServices.h
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Library\BaseCryptLib\InternalCryptLib.h
#;   5. InsydeModulePkg\Library\BaseCryptLib\Pk\CryptPkcs7.c
#;   6. InsydeModulePkg\Library\BaseCryptLib\Pk\CryptX509.c
#;   7. InsydeModulePkg\Library\VariableSupportLib\SecureBootSupport.c
#;   8. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Security\CryptoServiceRuntimeDxe\CryptoServiceProtocol.c
#;   9. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Security\CryptoServiceRuntimeDxe\CryptoServiceRuntimeDxe.c
#;   10. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Variable\VariableRuntimeDxe\AuthService.c
#;   11. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Variable\VariableRuntimeDxe\AuthService.h

#; Issue#: IB07300097
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: EDK2
#; Symptom: Sync edk2 trunk revision 13526
#; RootCause: Sync edk2 trunk revision 13526
#; Description: Sync edk2 trunk revision 13526
#; Solution: allow non-standard task priority level for a notify type of event
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; RelatedFiles:

#;
#; Tag#: 05.02.28
#; Issue#: IB07990067
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: Network
#; Symptom: UEFI PXE boot option show "EFI NETWORK"
#; RootCause: The compiler switch need change to PCD in Rev5.0
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Change compiler switch to PCD.
#;           2. Remove "Download NBP file" message after PXE image has loaded success.
#;           3. Sync network driver to implement "Network Stack" switch in SCU.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB04270000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. ChiefRiverPkg\PlatformPkg.dsc

#; Issue#: IB06710079
#; Severity: Feature
#; Category: Chipset Reference Code
#; Symptom: (New Feature)
#; RootCause: (New Feature)
#; Description: 1. Move PCH and MCH Reference Code to related ChipsetPkg.

#; Tag#: 05.02.27
#; Issue#: IB02040278
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom:
#;   1. Unable to detect full/low speed devices on VIA platform
#;   2. System hang when driver try to get the device name produced by UsbMassStorage driver
#; RootCause:
#;   1. When port owner route to CHC, the updated port status make the root port enumeration skipped the full/low devices. This is the side effect of IB02040262 item 1
#;   2. Wrong language code be specified and caused the device name did not set properly
#; Description: (This version of Seamless USB will labeled as 02.00.27.0706)
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.00.24.0622
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.00.15.0413
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.00.15.0413
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.00.11.0316
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.00.23.0608
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.00.23.0608
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.00.17.0427
#; Solution:
#;   1. Force the port enumeration continue to enumerate full/low device upon the port owner route to CHC
#;   2. Correct the language code to make the device name can be added into device name table
#; SolutionDependency: IB02040278 fixed the side effect of IB02040262 item 1
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbBusDxe\UsbBus.c
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbMassStorageDxe\UsbMassBoot.c
#;

#; Tag#: 05.02.26
#; Issue#: IB02960458
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: Variable
#; Symptom: Using gRT->SetVariable () to set volatile variable in ExitBootServices event failed.
#; RootCause: Volatile variable is read only at runtime (after ExitBootServices event), but the TPL in variable driver ExitBootServices event is TPL_NOTIFY.
#;            This behavior will cause other drivers set volatile variable in ExitBootServices event will be failed if the TPL is smaller than TPL TPL_NOTIFY.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Change the TPL in variable driver ExitBootServices event from TPL_NOTIFY to TPL_CALLBACK.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07240000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Variable\VariableRuntimeDxe\AuthService.c
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Variable\VariableRuntimeDxe\VariableRuntimeDxe.c

#; Tag#: 05.02.24
#; Issue#: IB02040274
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom:
#;   1. The Smart USB connection wrongly started by OS boot loader SetState command
#;   2. USB keyboard malfunction when Windows BitLocker prompt password dialog box when SCU USB hot key disabled
#;   3. USB keyboard/mouse hot plug malfunction on USB 2.0 port on some of Intel server platform
#; RootCause:
#;   1. The OS boot loader will always call the SetState function and causing USB connection started. This is the side effect of IB02040270 item 7
#;   2. The UsbBus driver skipped the connection after ReadyToBoot event in order to workaround LeagcyBios Disconnect whole native driver upon Legacy Oprom dispatching problem
#;   3. Some Intel server platform will generate babble error when low speed device hot plugged and caused device stop to re-enumeration
#; Description: (This version of Seamless USB will labeled as 02.00.24.0622)
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.00.24.0622
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.00.15.0413
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.00.15.0413
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.00.11.0316
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.00.23.0608
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.00.23.0608
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.00.17.0427
#; Solution:
#;   1. According to Microsoft spec, only ReadKeyStroke/Ex needed to hook the code for USB connection
#;   2. Remove the UsbBus skip connection code due to the code is useless on H2O 3.5B/3.7 code base
#;   3. Implement babble error recovery code to workaround this hardware fatal
#; SolutionDependency: IB02040274 fixed the side effect of IB02040271 item 7
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\EhciDxe.inf
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\Ia32\EhciDxe.efi
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\X64\EhciDxe.efi
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbBusDxe\UsbBus.c
#;   5. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbKbDxe\Efikey.c
#;
#;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#; Label#: 05.02.23
#; Status: Build tip : ~/StrawberryMountain   Test platform : StrawberryMountain DDR3
#;         1.Uefi64 and Uefi64ddt Compile successfully
#;         2.Uefi64 Boot to DOS successful
#;         3.Uefi64 Install Windows Windows8 8370 with no error
#;

#; Issue#: IB07010089
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Graphics
#; Symptom: 1.Virtual keyboard will display error when keyboard width is larger than 1024
#;          2.Virtual keyboard will display error when keyboard width is larger than screen width
#; RootCause: 1.Use fixed point to calculate keyboard button position, but give a too large scale factor (2^22), it will cause overflow.
#;            2.Doesn_t process over screen image.
#; Description: 1.(Bug Fix)
#;              2.(Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1.Use a suitable scale factor (2^16)
#;           2.Adjust keyboard size to fit screen size when default keyboard size is larger than screen size.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02960000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\SetupMouseDxe\SetupMouseKeyboard.c
#;
#; Tag#: 05.02.23
#; Issue#: IB02040271
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom:
#;   1. Grain Media USB2VGA unable to display when plugged in USB 3.0 port
#;   2. (ITS:0019322) After restart from OS, system will hang on 0x1B when plug a Seagate FreeAgent GoFlex USB 3.0 HDD in USB 3.0 port
#;   3. (ITS:0019436) Pei crisis on Xhci Controller with USB 3.0 device failed
#;   4. (ITS:0019493) System can't detect USB 3.0 dongle behind USB 3.0 HUB while system is in Setup Menu or POST phase( DOS, shell )
#;   5. Some USB 3.0 device unable to detected by VIA VL800 HC during POST
#;   6. The pause key unable to work on legacy free platform with UEFI boot mode
#;   7. (New feature) Pre-release for Smart USB connection used by improved Win8 fast boot at ww24
#; RootCause:
#;   1. XHCI HC driver unable to handle the large size(more than 2M) of bulk transfer
#;   2. Not enough timeout for first Inquiry command and caused device hang
#;   3. Wrongly use the compact format of maximum packet length for super seed device and caused USB 3.0 transmission error
#;   4. Some USB 3.0 HUB need more than 3 second to response the downstream port status and cause the device detection missed
#;   5. The USB 3.0 port reset using warm port reset command and caused Usb bus driver get the incorrect port status
#;   6. The pause key transfered to LegacyUsb driver but no CSM exist in UEFI boot mode
#;   7. (New feature) Pre-release for Smart USB connection used by improved Win8 fast boot at ww24
#; Description: (This version of Seamless USB will labeled as 02.00.23.0608)
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.00.15.0413
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.00.15.0413
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.00.15.0413
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.00.11.0316
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.00.23.0608
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.00.23.0608
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.00.17.0427
#; Solution:
#;   1. Redesign the XHCI driver to able to handle the large size transfer
#;   2. Enlarge the timeout to 12 seconds on first Inquiry command
#;   3. Correct the use of compact format of maximum packet length to set appropriate maximum packet length value to the related table
#;   4. Add stall with PID/VID for those USB 3.0 HUB to cover the HUB device detection delay
#;   5. Change the USB 3.0 port reset from warm reset to hot reset due to unnecessary
#;   6. Keep the pause key in UEFI keyboard driver to make it work under UEFI boot mode
#;   7. (New feature) Pre-release for Smart USB connection used by improved Win8 fast boot at ww24
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\Ia32\XhciDxe.efi
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\X64\XhciDxe.efi
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\XhciDxe.inf
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciPei\Ia32\XhciPei.efi
#;   5. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciPei\XhciPei.inf
#;   6. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbBotDxe\UsbMassBot.c
#;   7. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbBotDxe\UsbMassBot.h
#;   8. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbBusDxe\Hub.c
#;   9. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbBusPei\UsbIo.c
#;   10. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbKbDxe\Efikey.c
#;   11. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbKbDxe\Efikey.h
#;   12. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbKbDxe\Keyboard.c
#;   13. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbKbDxe\UsbKbDxe.inf
#;   14. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbMassStoragePei\UsbBot.c
#;   15. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbMassStoragePei\UsbMassStoragePei.c
#;   16. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbMassStoragePei\UsbMassStoragePei.h
#;

#; Issue#: IB07300000
#; Severity: Trivial
#; Category: StrawberryMountain
#; Symptom: Update OemRevision (05.02.22)
#; RootCause: (Update OemRevision)
#; Description: (Update OemRevision)
#; Solution: (Update OemRevision)
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. StrawberryMtPkg\BiosInfo.uni
#;
#; Tag#: 05.02.22
#; Issue#: IB02960453
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: Secure Boot
#; Symptom: In CloverTrail platform, after enable "Restore Secure Boot to Factory Settings" option in Administer Secure Boot menu and reset system, system will always reset during every POST.
#; RootCause: After executing restore factory default, the variable store size in firmware is cleared to 0xFFFFFFFF. And then system will use this size and variable store start address to
#;            calculate the variable end address. In 32 bit environment, the variable end address will smaller than start address (caused by overflow). Therefore, system cannot find
#;            "RestoreFactoryDefault" variable between variable start address and end address and system cannot delete this variable.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Using original variable store size instead of variable store size in factory default region to execute restore factory default.
#;           2. Save variable store size in memory, and always get variable store size from memory to prevent from the data is modified by other mechanism.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB07240000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Library\VariableSupportLib\SecureBootSupport.c
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Library\VariableSupportLib\VariableSupportLib.c
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Variable\VariableDefaultUpdateDxe\VariableDefaultUpdateMisc.c
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Variable\VariableRuntimeDxe\Reclaim.c
#;   5. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Variable\VariableRuntimeDxe\Variable.c
#;   6. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Variable\VariableRuntimeDxe\Variable.h
#;
#; Tag#: 05.02.22
#; Issue#: IB05670058
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: IRSI
#; Symptom: 1. IRSI Factory Copy Management did not work on CloverTrail platform
#;          2. The first stage firmware could not be accessed via IRSI Read/Write Image function
#; RootCause: 1. Variable FvRegionInfo protocol was not installed
#;            2. Firmware Management driver did not get FvRegionInfo protocol of the boot partition installed on the eMMC FVB driver

#; Tag#: 05.02.22
#; Issue#: IB03600483
#; Severity: Serious
#; Category: File System
#; Symptom: RAID 0 will crash when change SATA mode from RAID to AHCI.
#; RootCause: When SATA mode changes form RAID to AHCI, the partition function will restore wrong backup GPT table to primary GPT table.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Do not restore primary GPT table when backup GPT table is wrong.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02700000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Disk\PartitionDxe\Gpt.c
#;
#; Tag#: 05.02.22
#; Issue#: IB02960325
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: File System
#; Symptom: If primary partition table is corrupted and backup partition table doesn't locate in last block, the backup mechanism for GPT table cannot work.
#; RootCause: If primary partition table is corrupted, it always reads from last block to fix these corrupted data.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Write backup partition table to last block if it doesn't locate in last block.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB02700000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Added:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Disk\PartitionDxe\

#; Tag#: 05.02.21
#; Issue#: IB10620002
#; Severity: Feature
#; Category: ACPI
#; Symptom: (New Feature)
#; RootCause: (New Feature)
#; Description: 1. Implement AcpiWpbtProtocol to install WPBT ACPI table
#;              2. Implement a sample driver - InstallWpbt to locate the AcpiWpbtProtocol,
#;                 and to provide the file guide of executable to the protocol.
#;              3. Implement a sample executable - native.exe encapsulated in FV,
#;                 and be read into memory by AcpiWpbtProtocol

#; Issue#: IB02040269
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom:
#;   POST hang when ADATA N005 USB3.0 device plugged in ChiefRiver USB3 port with XHCI set to Auto or Smart Auto mode
#; RootCause:
#;   The USB3 signal remaining active when USB3 port routed to EHCI, and caused device firmware confusing. This is chipset signal and device firmware issue(Same as IB02040256 item 1)
#; Description: (This version of Seamless USB will labeled as 02.00.21.0525)
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.00.15.0413
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.00.15.0413
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.00.15.0413

#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.00.11.0316
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.00.15.0413
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.00.15.0413
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.00.17.0427

#; Tag#: 05.02.18
#; Issue#: IB07240109
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: SCT
#; Symptom: The failed items of UEFI2.3.1 SCT Test
#;          1. In UEFI Compliant - Globally Defined Variables test, "PlatformLangCodes" variable is illegal Variable.
#;          2. HII_CONFIG_ACCCESS_PROTOCOL.ExtractConfig() returns EFI_DEVICE_ERROR with valid parameters. It should return EFI_SUCCESS.
#;          3. HII_CONFIG_ACCESS_PROTOCOL.RouteConfig() returns EFI_SUCCESS with valid parameters but output parameter Progress doesn't points
#;             to the Configuration.
#; RootCause: 1. The attribute of "PlatformLangCodes" variable is NV, BS and RT. But based on the definition of section 3.2 of UEFI spec 2.3.1,
#;               it should be BS and RT.
#;            2. In ExtractConfig() function of secure boot manager, write the wrong WIDTH value in the string of <ConfigResp> format.
#;               It makes it always return EFI_DEVICE_ERROR.
#;            3. In RouteConfig() function of secure boot manager, output parameter Progress doesn't be updated to point to the Configuration.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Correct the attribute of "PlatformLangCodes" variable to BS and RT.
#;           2. In ExtractConfig() function of secure boot manager, correct the WIDTH value in the string of <ConfigResp> format.
#;           3. In RouteConfig() function of secure boot manager, update output parameter Progress to point to the Configuration.
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer: IB04170000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeFrameworkModulePkg\Platform\Generic\Dxe\UefiPlatformBds\SecureBootMgr\SecureBootMgr.c
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Disk\UnicodeCollationDxe\UnicodeCollation.c

#; Tag#: 05.02.17
#; Issue#: IB02040267
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom:
#;   1. (ITS:18348) Touch screen can not work in SCU
#;   2. (ITS:18198, 18541) The NumLock, Caps & Scroll LEDs are not sync in SCU under Dual Boot Type and Legacy Boot Type mode on legacy free platform
#;   3. (New feature) Export mass storage device name to EfiComponentName(2) protocol for use of external EFI drivers
#;   4. (New feature) Export USB working memory region information to EFI system configuration table for use of external EFI drivers
#; RootCause:
#;   1. Some incompatible device will postpone the first event around 10 seconds, this is specific device firmware behavior
#;   2. No sync LED function implemented on legacy free (no KBC) platform
#;   3. (New feature) Export mass storage device name to EfiComponentName(2) protocol for use of external EFI drivers
#;   4. (New feature) Export USB working memory region information to EFI system configuration table for use of external EFI drivers
#; Description: (This version of Seamless USB will labeled as 02.00.17.0427)
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.00.15.0413
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.00.15.0413
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.00.15.0413
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.00.11.0316
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.00.15.0413
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.00.15.0413
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.00.17.0427
#; Solution:
#;   1. To launch GetFeature command twice with the parameter of first feature report ID and maximum feature length, and launch GetString to get vendor string to workaround this issue
#;   2. Move the sync LED function from UsbLegacy to UsbCore driver to utilize for both of KBC and non-KBC platform
#;   3. (New feature) Export mass storage device name to EfiComponentName(2) protocol for use of external EFI drivers
#;   4. (New feature) Export USB working memory region information to EFI system configuration table for use of external EFI drivers
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer:IB04170000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbCoreDxe\MemMng.c

#; Tag#: 05.02.15
#; Issue#: IB05670048
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: S3 Resume
#; Symptom: S3 resume fails if 4G or above memory is installed
#; RootCause: The ACPI_VARIABLE_SET structure and GUID definitions are not identical
#; Description: Fixed S3 resume issue with 4G or above memory installed
#; Solution: 1. Synchronize the ACPI_VARIABLE_SET and gEfiAcpiVariableGuid definitions under InsydeFrameworkModulePkg and ChipsetCRB folder
#;           2. Add InsydeModulePkg/Universal/Acpi/AcpiS3SaveDxe/AcpiS3SaveDxe driver to replace the original IntelFrameworkModulePkg/Universal/Acpi/AcpiS3SaveDxe/AcpiS3SaveDxe.inf

#; Tag#: 05.02.10
#; Issue#: IB02040266
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom:
#;   1. SCT 2.3.1 test error the item of USB Support Test\USB IO Protocol Test
#;   2. Unable to detect ELAN CANDO touch panel during POST
#;   3. Sometimes SCU doesn't response immediately when user selecting an item through touch panel
#;   4. USB EHCI/OHCI HC detecting failed on new AMD platforms with non SMM mode
#; RootCause:
#;   1. The USB HC did not handle well on the timeout parameter set to zero
#;   2. Wrongly use interrupt-out endpoint for interrupt-in transfer
#;   3. Some touch panel device only return X, Y value in first touch event. It will not set EFI_ABSP_TouchActive
#;   4. The bit 2 in HC BAR be set to indicating 64 bits addressing, this bit did not masked when USB driver getting the BAR value and caused HC detecting failed
#; Description: (This version of Seamless USB will labeled as 02.00.15.0413)
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.00.15.0413
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.00.15.0413
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.00.15.0413
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.00.11.0316
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.00.15.0413
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.00.15.0413
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.00.14.0406
#; Solution:
#;   1. Return EF_DEVICE_ERROR instead of EFI_TIMEOUT upon timeout occurred when timeout value set to zero
#;   2. Correct the endpoint filtering routine to get correct interrupt-in endpoint
#;   3. Postpone the response of AbsolutePointer GetStatus until EFI_ABSP_TouchActive status changed
#;   4. Change the mask of BAR from 0x03 to 0x0f to get the correct BAR value
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Deleted:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbTouchPanelDxe\UsbTouchPanelHid.c
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbTouchPanelDxe\UsbTouchPanelHid.h
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\EhciDxe.inf
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\Ia32\EhciDxe.efi
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\X64\EhciDxe.efi
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciPei\EhciPei.inf
#;   5. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciPei\Ia32\EhciPei.efi
#;   6. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\OhciDxe\Ia32\OhciDxe.efi
#;   7. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\OhciDxe\OhciDxe.inf
#;   8. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\OhciDxe\X64\OhciDxe.efi
#;   9. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\Ia32\XhciDxe.efi
#;   10. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\X64\XhciDxe.efi
#;   11. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciDxe\XhciDxe.inf
#;   12. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciPei\Ia32\XhciPei.efi
#;   13. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\XhciPei\XhciPei.inf
#;   14. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbCoreDxe\UsbPciIo.c
#;   15. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbTouchPanelDxe\UsbTouchPanel.c
#;   16. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbTouchPanelDxe\UsbTouchPanel.h
#;   17. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbTouchPanelDxe\UsbTouchPanelDxe.inf

#; Tag#: 05.02.10
#; Issue#: IB02040262
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom:
#;   1. Full/low speed device doesn't work on non-SMM platform
#;   2. System hang under DOS when touch panel is touched
#;   3. After system displayed "No bootable device -- insert boot disk and press any key", system cannot continue to boot from USB ODD
#;   4. USB EHCI/OHCI HC detecting failed on new AMD platforms
#; RootCause:
#;   1. The ResetRootPort did not reset the port and caused device initial failed
#;   2. USB touch panel driver only work during POST time, but USB touch panel callback function is called at runtime and caused hang
#;   3. USB ODD image detecting at POST, and it hasn't retry mechanism in BEV handle of USB when insert a bootable image
#;   4. The bit 2 in HC BAR be set to indicating 64 bits addressing, this bit did not masked when USB driver getting the BAR value and caused HC detecting failed
#; Description: (This version of Seamless USB will labeled as 02.00.14.0406)
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.00.14.0406
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.00.11.0316
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.00.11.0316
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.00.11.0316
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.00.14.0406
#; Solution:
#;   1. Adjust the ResetRootPort function to reset the root port
#;   2. Disconnect USB touch panel upon "legacy boot" or "exit boot services" event triggered
#;   3. Re-detect USB ODD image in INT19h function when press any key. Please do update the 096/Legacy16.bin(version 1513) at IB02700367
#;   4. Change the mask of BAR from 0x03 to 0x0f to get the correct BAR value
#; SolutionDependency: IB02040262 item 4 fixed the side effect of IB02040260 item 1
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\EhciDxe.inf
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\Ia32\EhciDxe.efi
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\EhciDxe\X64\EhciDxe.efi
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbBusDxe\UsbBus.c
#;   5. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbCoreDxe\UsbCoreDxe.c
#;   6. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbCoreDxe\UsbPciIo.c
#;   7. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbTouchPanelDxe\UsbTouchPanel.c
#;   8. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbTouchPanelDxe\UsbTouchPanel.h
#;   9. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbTouchPanelDxe\UsbTouchPanelDxe.inf
#;   10. InsydeModulePkg\Csm\UsbLegacySmm\Ia32\UsbLegacySmm.efi
#;   11. InsydeModulePkg\Csm\UsbLegacySmm\UsbLegacySmm.inf
#;   12. InsydeModulePkg\Csm\UsbLegacySmm\X64\UsbLegacySmm.efi
#;

#; Tag#: 05.02.10
#; Issue#: IB08340050
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Security
#; Symptom: 1. Some secure flash relative variables are not defined in UEFI specification section 3.2 use EFI_GALOBAL_VARIALBE_GUID. According to EFI specification, this behavior is forbidden.
#;          2. After disable enforce secure boot option in Administer Secure Boot menu, an unsigned BIOS can be flashed.
#; RootCause: 1. We use EFI_VARIALBE_GUID for most of secure flash relative variables.
#;            2. The algorithm to determine want to do signature check is incorrect in flash mode.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: 1. Change GUID of the secure flash related variables from gEfiGlobalVariableGuid to gSecureFlashInfoGuid.
#;           2. Correct the algorithm to must do signature check in secure flash mode.
#; SolutionDependency: 1. None
#;                     2. IB08340050 fixed side effect of IB02960419 (Adopted in 03.72.03)
#; Reviewer: IB02960000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Library\DxeImageVerificationLib\DxeImageVerificationLib.c
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Library\DxeImageVerificationLib\DxeImageVerificationLib.inf
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Security\SecureFlash\SecureFlashDxe\SecureFlashDxe.c
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Universal\Security\SecureFlash\SecureFlashDxe\SecureFlashDxe.inf

#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Variable
#; Symptom: Some variables are not defined in UEFI specification section use EFI_GALOBAL_VARIALBE_GUID. According to EFI specification, this behavior is forbidden.
#; RootCause: We use EFI_VARIALBE_GUID for most of our specific defined variables.

#; Tag#: 05.02.10
#; Issue#: IB05670044
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: FdSupportLib
#; Symptom: FvbServicesRuntimeDxe cannot work on SharkBay platform

#; Issue#: IB02040260
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom:
#;   1. (New Feature) The non-SMM platform support
#;   2. (ITS:17374) System hang when plug SONY USM-Q series flash driver size over 32GB on USB 3.0 port during POST
#;   3. (ITS:17503) System hang when plug Kingston DataTraveler 200 64GB flash drive during POST
#; RootCause:
#;   1. (New Feature) The non-SMM platform support
#;   2. Same as IB02040256 item 1 but this device will sometime failed on BOT data phase, not only BOT status phase
#;   3. Not enough timeout (10 seconds) on RequestSense BOT data phase for this device
#; Description: (This version of Seamless USB will labeled as 02.00.11.0316)
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.00.11.0316
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.00.11.0316
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.00.11.0316
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.00.11.0316
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.00.07.0217
#; Solution:
#;   1. (New feature) The non-SMM platform support
#;   2. Add timeout detection at USB BOT data phase to workaround this fatal device
#;   3. Add RequestSense detection with enlarge timeout value to 12 seconds for this kind of device
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer:IB04170000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:

#; Tag#: 05.02.07
#; Issue#: IB07990052
#; Severity: Feature
#; Category: Network
#; Symptom: (New Feature)
#; RootCause: (New Feature)
#; Description:
#;   1. Sync Network Stack source code to Component\NetworkStack.EDKII
#;      Set NetworkStack switch, UEFI_NETWORK_SUPPORT, DUAL_NETWORK_ENABLE in Calpella, ChiefRiver, HuronRiver, StrawBerryMountain in Rev5.0.
#;   2. Network boot option policy
#;     (1). Remove iScsi, UefiPxeBc4, Tcp4, TelnetServer, SimpleSocket driver.
#;     (2). Only support UEFI or Legacy OPROM at the same time.
#;     (3). The SCU "Pxe Boot to LAN" display policy:
#;         UEFI Mode   : UEFI:IPv4, UEFI:IPv6, UEFI:IPv4/IPv6
#;         Dual Mode   : UEFI:IPv4, UEFI:IPv6, UEFI:IPv4/IPv6, Legacy
#;         Legacy Mode : Hidden, only Legacy
#;        The NetworkLocker driver will control network stack driver via protocol dependency.
#;        It's control IPv4 and IPv6 capability from SCU.
#;
#;      Boot Type  | PXE Boot to LAN | UEFI PXE Boot | Native Driver | Network Stack Driver
#;     ------------+-----------------+---------------+---------------+----------------------
#;      ALL        |    Disable      | Option Hidden |   Not Loaded  |   Not Loaded
#;      UEFI, Dual |    Enable       |   IPv4        |   Loaded      |   Only IPv4
#;      UEFI, Dual |    Enable       |   IPv6        |   Loaded      |   Only IPv6
#;      UEFI, Dual |    Enable       |   IPv4/IPv6   |   Loaded      |   Both loaded
#;      Dual       |    Enable       |   Legacy      |   PXE OPROM   |   Not Loaded
#;      Legacy     |    Enable       | Option Hidden |   PXE OPROM   |   Not Loaded
#; Solution: (New Feature)
#; Reviewer: IB04270000
#; SolutionDependency: None
#;
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Added:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Include\Guid\NetworkEventGroup.h
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Platform\Generic\IntelGigLan\

#; Tag#: 05.02.07
#; Issue#: IB02040256
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: USB
#; Symptom:
#;   1. (ITS17234) POST hang when some of USB3.0 device plugged in ChiefRiver USB3 port with XHCI set to Auto or Smart Auto mode
#;   2. (ITS17373) System hang on booting to USB FDD on the platform with OHCI system
#;   3. (ITS16776) Unable to install Windows Server2003 through USB ODD
#; RootCause:
#;   1. The USB3 signal remaining active when USB3 port routed to EHCI, and caused device firmware confusing. This is chipset signal and device firmware issue
#;   2. The unfinished CurrentBufferPtr in OHCI ED be referenced and caused the total length counting error. This is the side effect of IB02040247 item 4
#;   3. The LBA + length requested by Int13 exceed the last LBA and caused reading error
#; Description: Sync with 01.54.07.0217 on H2O 3.5B/3.7 code base(This version of Seamless USB will labeled as 02.00.07.0217)
#;   EHCI DXE  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   EHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   OHCI DXE  : 02.00.07.0214
#;   OHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   UHCI DXE  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   UHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   XHCI DXE  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   XHCI PEI  : 02.00.06.0210
#;   UsbLegacy : 02.00.07.0217
#; Solution:
#;   1. Added the workaround to bypass those kind of devices through PID/VID matching when error occurred
#;   2. Added retry to get correct CurrentBufferPtr value
#;   3. Adjust the length do not exceed the last LBA
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; Reviewer:IB04170000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\OhciDxe\Ia32\OhciDxe.efi
#;   2. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\OhciDxe\OhciDxe.inf
#;   3. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Pci\OhciDxe\X64\OhciDxe.efi
#;   4. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbBotDxe\UsbMassBot.c
#;   5. InsydeModulePkg\Bus\Usb\UsbBotDxe\UsbMassBot.h
#;   6. InsydeModulePkg\Csm\UsbLegacySmm\Ia32\UsbLegacySmm.efi
#;   7. InsydeModulePkg\Csm\UsbLegacySmm\UsbLegacySmm.inf
#;   8. InsydeModulePkg\Csm\UsbLegacySmm\X64\UsbLegacySmm.efi
#;
#; Tag#: 05.02.06

#; Issue#: IB02040250
#; Severity: Feature
#; Category: ECP
#; Symptom: (New feature)
#; RootCause: (New Feature)
#; Description: The ECP module for SmmUsbDispatch which used for the conversion of EDK style USB SMI registration/dispatching on EDKII code base
#; Solution: (New Feature)
#; SolutionDependency: None
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Added:

#; Issue#: IB05670037
#; Severity: Minor
#; Category: Build
#; Symptom: 1. Build process will fail if insert comment lines between two lines with line connection symbol '\' in Platform.env
#;          2. Build process fails if ASL_PATH is modified to a different path
#;          3. No mechanism to add BIOS ID in the top segment (64K) of 4G address space.
#; RootCause: 1. The comment line is not ignored if it is between to lines with line connection symbol '\'
#;            2. ASL_PATH is not correctly set
#;            3. (feature)
#; Description: 1. Modify MetaFileParser.py to ignore comment lines between to lines with line connection symbol
#;              2. Update BaseTools\H2ORev50.bat to fix ASL_PATH parsing
#;              3. Add BiosId declaration in PlatformSecLib.c and modify PE32 alignment in Rules section in PlatformPkg.fdf for SEC file.
#; Solution: 1. Modify MetaFileParser.py to ignore comment lines between to lines with line connection symbol
#;           2. Update BaseTools\H2ORev50.bat to fix ASL_PATH parsing
#;           3. Add BiosId declaration in PlatformSecLib.c and modify PE32 alignment in Rules section in PlatformPkg.fdf for SEC file.

#; Reviewer: IB07300000

#; Tag#: 05.01.51
#; Issue#: IB05670036
#; Severity: Fatal
#; Category: Build
#; Symptom: Hang-up on Calpella Platform
#; RootCause: The override MpCpu.dxs was not effected.
#; Description: 1. Sync. BaseTools with EDK SVN 12879 (Update)
#;              2. The update is to fix that the .dxs depependency file cannot be overriden and causes hang-up on Calpella platform due to MpCpu.dxs not being overriden
#; Solution: Update Build tool.
#; SolutionDependency:
#; Reviewer: IB07300000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. BaseTools\Bin\Win32\GenFds.exe
#;   2. BaseTools\Bin\Win32\build.exe
#;   3. BaseTools\Source\Python\AutoGen\AutoGen.py
#;   4. BaseTools\Source\Python\Workspace\WorkspaceDatabase.py
#;
#; Tag#: 05.01.51
#; Issue#: IB05670036
#; Severity: Feature

#; Tag#: 05.01.50
#; Issue#: IB02960411
#; Severity: Medium
#; Category: Secure Boot
#; Symptom: The performance of Image verification process is too bad if this image hash is in forbidden database (dbx).
#; RootCause: Image verify algorithm verify allowed database first. But even system verifies image through allowed database, system still need check with forbidden database to make sure this image isn't forbidden.
#; Description: (Bug Fix)
#; Solution: Correct the algorithm to verify image through forbidden database first and then verify image through allowed database.
#; Reviewer: IB07240000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. InsydeModulePkg\InsydeModulePkg.dsc

#; Tag#: 05.01.29
#; Issue#: IB05670007
#; Category: Build
#; Symptom: .dsc parsing failure
#; RootCause: Incorrect syntax checking in MetaFileParser.py
#; Description: This modification fixes the following issues
#;              1. Parsing error for c-style comments in .INF files
#;              2.  Parsing error for conditional directives (!if, !ifdef, !elif) if the identifier in the conditional directive is not defined
#;              3.  Identifiers defined in the .dsc file are not recognized in the .fdf file.
#;              Add manual for EDK2 Base Tools under BaseTools folder
#; Solution: 1. By-pass lines if BlockCommentFound is set to TRUE
#;           2. Modify Evaluate() function in DscParser class
#;           3. Store global macros definition in .dsc to database in DscParser class Start() function
#; View: IB02960000
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Added:
#;   1. BaseTools\UserManuals\

#;   2. CalpellaPkg\Override\InsydeFrameworkModulePkg\Library\BvdtLib\BvdtLib.c
#;
#; Tag#: 05.01.27
#; Issue#: IB05670006
#; Category: Memory
#; Symptom: Unable to install EFI Linux OS with grub Linux boot loader
#; RootCause: 1. CopyMem() function failure causes system reset while loading grub boot loader
#; Description: 1. The InternalMemCopyMem() use Intel SSE2 to optimize the performance of memory copy, but it leads to CPU exception.
#;              2. The Library Instance BaseMemoryLibOptDxe.inf for BaseMemoryLib uses Intel SSE2 feature to copy memory
#; Solution: Change the Library Instance for BaseMemoryLib to BaseMemoryLibRepStr.inf
#; RelatedFiles:
#; Modified:
#;   1. CalpellaPkg\PlatformPkg.dsc
